translation.en: In Berlin, police estimated 6,500 protestors.
translation.yo: Ní Berlin, iléeṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá ti ṣí àwọn olùsèfẹ̀inúhàn ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́fà ó lé ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbẹ̀ta.

translation.en: Protests also took place in Paris, Sofia in Bulgaria, Vilnius in Lithuania, Valetta in Malta, Tallinn in Estonia, and Edinburgh and Glasgow in Scotland.
translation.yo: Ìfẹ̀húnú hàn tún wáyé ní ìlú Pàrísì, Sofia ní Bọ̀lùgáríà, Fílínọ́s ní Lìtùánà, Fàlẹ́tà ní Málítà, Tàlínì ní Ẹsitóníà, àti Ẹdínbọ́gù àti Gílásígò ní Ìlú Scotland.

translation.en: In London, about 200 people protested outside some major copyright holders' offices.
translation.yo: Nìlú Londoni o tó bìí èyàn 200 tó fìfè éhónú hàn níwájú dìé nínú àwọn ilé isé nla tó n di ètò ìlò mu.

translation.en: Last month, there were major protests in Poland when that country signed ACTA, which has led to the Polish government deciding not to ratify the agreement, for now.
translation.yo: Ni osu to koja, itako nla pupo wa ni Polandi nigbati orileede naa fowo si ACTA, to muu ki ijoba Polandi pinu lati ma fowo si adehun naa, nisiyin.

translation.en: Latvia and Slovakia have both delayed the process of joining ACTA.
translation.yo: Latvia àti Slovakia ti mún ìdádúró bá ìlànà àti darapọ̀ mọ́ ACTA.

translation.en: Animal Liberation and the Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (RSPCA) are again calling for the mandatory installation of CCTV cameras in all Australian abattoirs.
translation.yo: Ìtúsílẹ̀ Ęranko àti Ęgbẹ́ Ọlọ́ba tó Lòdí sí fífi àwọn ẹranko jìyà (RSPCA) wọ́n ti ń pè fún fífí kámẹ́rà ìṣóni tó n jẹ́ CCTV sí gbogbo ilé pęran pęran ní Ìlú Australian.

translation.en: RSPCA New South Wales chief inspector David O'Shannessy told the ABC that surveillance and inspections of abattoirs should be commonplace in Australia.
translation.yo: RSPCA New South Wales olùbẹ̀wò David O'Shanessy sọ fún ABC pé àkíyèsí àti ìbẹ̀wò ibi ti wọ́n ti n pa ẹran niláti jẹ́ ibi tí gbogbo ènìyàn ms ní Australia.

translation.en: "The CCTV would certainly send a strong signal to those people working with animals that their welfare is of the highest priority."
translation.yo: “CCTV ma fi àmì tó lágbára ṣọwọ́ sí àwọn ènìyàn tó ṣe iṣẹ́ pẹ̀lú àwọn ẹranko nítorí àláfíà wọn ló jù.”

translation.en: The United States Geological Survey international earthquake map showed no earthquakes in Iceland in the week prior.
translation.yo: Máàpù ìwáádìí ẹ̀kọ nípa ilẹ̀ ohun ìwárìrì-ilẹ̀ ti orìlé-èdè, Amerika sàfihàn pẹ́ ́àwọǹ ìwárìrì-ilẹ kò sẹlẹ̀ ni Iceland ni ọ̀sẹ̀ tó sáájú.

translation.en: The Icelandic Meteorological Office also reported no earthquake activity in the Hekla area in the past 48 hours.
translation.yo: ọfíìsì Icelandic Meteorological náà kò ní àkọsílẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ni agbègbè Helka láti bí wakàtí méjìdín ní àádọ́ta sẹ́yì.

translation.en: The significant earthquake activity resulting in the phase change had took place on March 10 on the northeast side of the volcano's summit caldera.
translation.yo: Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìwárìrì ilẹ̀ tó ní ipa mú àbájáde dé bá ibi àyípadà àkọ́kọ́ tó wáyé ní ọjọ́ Kẹ̀wá Oṣù Kẹta ní àríwá ìlà-Òòrùn igun ní bi àpapò àwọn òkè.

translation.en: Dark clouds unrelated to any volcanic activity were reported at the base of the mountain.
translation.yo: Wọ́n ròyìn orun tí kò jẹ mọ́ jẹmọ́ ìṢesí folkano ní ẹsẹ̀ oké náà.

translation.en: The clouds presented the potential for confusion as to whether an actual eruption had taken place.
translation.yo: Kùrukùru ń fa ìrújú lórí bóyá ìbúgbàmù ti wáyé.

translation.en: The Luno had 120–160 cubic metres of fuel aboard when it broke down and high winds and waves pushed it into the breakwater.
translation.yo: Ọkọ̀ ojú omi náà gbé ọgọ́fà sí ọgọ́jọ ìwọ̀n mita epo nígbà tí ó dẹnu kọlẹ̀ tí ìjì àti ìgbì tì í sínú ibi ọkọ̀ omi .

translation.en: Helicopters rescued the twelve crewmembers and the only injury was a broken nose.
translation.yo: Oko ofurufu gba awom mejila to je osise inu baalu na la ati pe enikan lo fi imu sese.

translation.en: The 100-metre ship was en route to pick up its usual fertiliser cargo and initially officials feared the vessel could spill a load.
translation.yo: Ọkọ̀ ojú omi 100 metre tí padà láti lọ gbé àwọn ajílẹ̀ àwọn òṣìṣk sì bẹ̀rù pé ọkọ̀ náà lè dànù lọ́nà.

translation.en: The proposed amendment already passed both houses in 2011.
translation.yo: Àbá àtúnse tigbawájú ilé méjéèjì kọjá lọ́dún 2011.

translation.en: A change was made this legislative session when the second sentence was deleted first by the House of Representatives and then was passed in a similar form by the Senate Monday.
translation.yo: Àyípadà wáyé níjòòkó ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin nígbà tí Ilé Igbìmọ̀ Asojúsòfin pa ìdájọ́ àkọ́kọ́ rẹ́, tí wọ́n sì tí ilé ìgbímọ̀ asòfin àpapọ̀ sì buwọ́lu àbá tó fara pẹ́ẹ lọ́jọ́ ajé.

translation.en: The failure of the second sentence, which proposes to ban same-sex civil unions, could possibly open the door for civil unions in the future.
translation.yo: Ìkùnà ọ̀rọ̀ kejì, tí ó gbèrò láti fòpin sí same sex civil unions, lè ṣí ìlẹ́kùn fún civil union ní ọjọ ìwájú.

translation.en: Following the process, HJR-3 will be reviewed again by the next elected legislature in either 2015 or 2016 to remain in process.
translation.yo: Ní sísèntèlé ìlànà náà, àwọn ìgbìmò asòfin ti a máà yan máà tún sẹ àgbéyèwò HJR-3, ní odún 2015 tàbí 2016 kó ma sàíj´ ìlànà.

translation.en: Vautier's achievements outside of directing include a hunger strike in 1973 against what he viewed as political censorship.
translation.yo: Yàtọ̀ ise takun takun ni ṣíṣe olùdarí, ara àwọn ohun tí Fọ́tíyà gbéṣe ni ìdájíjẹsílẹ̀ ní ọdún 1973 láti takò nkan tí ó jọmọ́ ìpanilẹ́numọ́ ti òṣèl.

translation.en: French law was changed. His activism went back to age 15 when he joined the French Resistance during World War II.
translation.yo: Àyípadà bá òfin ilẹ Faransé. À ti ọdún márùndínlógún ló ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìjàgbara nígbà tí ó darápọ̀ mọ́ àwọn ajagun ilẹ̀ faransé lákòókò ogun àgbáyé kejì.

translation.en: He documented himself in a 1998 book.
translation.yo: O fi orúkọ rẹ sílẹ̀ sínú ìwé 1998.

translation.en: In the 1960s he headed back to newly-independent Algeria to teach film directing.
translation.yo: Lọ́dún !960, ó padà sí ilẹ̀ olómìnira tuntun Algeria láti kọ́ ìdarí fíìmù.

translation.en: Japanese judoka Hitoshi Saito, winner of two Olympic gold medals, has died at the age of 54.
translation.yo: Japanese judoka Hitoshi Saito, olúborí Olympic gold medals méjì, kú ni ọmọ ọdún mẹrìnléláàdọ́ta.

translation.en: The cause of death was announced as intrahepatic bile duct cancer.
translation.yo: Jẹjẹrẹ òróòro ni wọn kéde pé ó fa ikú náà.

translation.en: He died in Osaka on Tuesday.
translation.yo: O ṣe aláìsi ní Osaka ní Ọjọ́ Ìségun.

translation.en: As well as a former Olympic and World champion, Saito was the All Japan Judo Federation training committee chairman at the time of his death.
translation.yo: Bí ó ti jẹ́ ọ̀gágun ní ìgbà kan rí fún ìdíje Olympic àti ti olúborí àgbáyé, bákan náà ni Saito jẹ́ the alága ìgbìmọ̀ gbogbogbò fún ìdíje Judo ti ilẹ̀ Japan títí dí ọjọ́ ikú rẹ̀.

translation.en: At least 100 people had attended the party, in order to celebrate the first anniversary of a couple whose wedding was held last year.
translation.yo: Ó kéré jù ọgọ́rún àwọn ènìyàn ló wá sí àpèjẹ náà, láti ṣàjọyọ àṣeyẹ àkọ́kọ́ tókọtaya tí ọja ìgbeyàwó wọ́n jẹ ọdún tó kọjá.

translation.en: A formal anniversary event was scheduled for a later date, officials said.
translation.yo: Ètò ayẹyẹ nígbàkanrí ni wọ́n sàgbékalẹ̀ lọ́jọ́ míràn gẹ́gẹ́ bí àwọn aláṣẹ se wí.

translation.en: The couple had married in Texas one year ago and came to Buffalo to celebrate with friends and relatives.
translation.yo: Tọkọ tí ìyàwó ti Ṣe ìyàwó ní Tegsaasi ọdún kan sẹ́yìn , wọ́n wá láti bá àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ àti mọ̀lẹ́bí won yọ.

translation.en: The 30-year-old husband, who was born in Buffalo, was one of the four killed in the shooting, but his wife was not hurt.
translation.yo: Ọkọ rẹ̀ ẹni ọgbọ̀n ọdún tí wọ́n bí ní Buffalo ní ó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn mẹ́rin tí wọ́n sekúpa nínú ìyìnbọn pani, sùgbọ́n ìyàwó rẹ̀ kò fara pa.

translation.en: Karno is a well-known but controversial English tutor who taught under Modern Education and King's Glory who claimed to have 9,000 students at the peak of his career.
translation.yo: Karno jẹ́ gbajúgbajà olùkọ́ èdè òyìnbó, ṣùgbọ́n ó tún jẹ́ aláríyànjiyàn olùkọ́ tó ṣiṣẹ́ lábẹ́ Modern Education and king’s Glory to sọpé àwọn ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́sàn-án akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tó ń lékè níbi iṣẹ́ wọn.

translation.en: In his notes he used words which some parents considered coarse, and he reportedly used profanity in class.
translation.yo: Ninu ikosile re o lo awon oro to le ni imo awon obi won ni o de ma n lo oro buruku ni kilaasi.

translation.en: Modern Education accused him of printing large advertisements on buses without authorisation and lying by saying that he was the chief English tutor.
translation.yo: Ẹ̀kọ́ ìgbàlódé fẹ̀sùn kàán fún ṣíṣàtẹ̀jáde ìpolówó tó pọ̀ nínu ọkọ̀ akérò láì gba àṣẹ tó sì parọ́ nípa síso pé òhun ní olùkọ́ Èdè gẹ̀ẹ́sì.

translation.en: He has also been accused previously of copyright infringement, but was not charged.
translation.yo: Wọn ti kàn lẹ́sùn jíja olè iṣé agbárí , ṣùgbọ́n wọn o gbé lọ sí ile ẹjọ́.

translation.en: A former student said that he 'used slang in class, taught dating skills in notes, and was just like the students' friend.'
translation.yo: Akẹkọ nigba kan ri sọ wipe ‘oun a ma sọ isọkusọ ninu yara ikawe, a ma kọni ni ọgbọn ibasepọ ninu iwe, o si dabi ọrẹ si gbogbo awon akẹkọ.’

translation.en: During the last three decades, despite officially remaining a communist state, China has developed a market economy.
translation.yo: Nígbà ọgbọ̀n ọdún sẹ́yìn,pẹ̀lú jíjẹ́ ìpínlẹ̀ tó fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀, China ti ní ètò ọrọ̀ ajé tó ga jù.

translation.en: The first economic reforms were made under the leadership of Deng Xiaoping.
translation.yo: Abe idari Deng Xiaoping ni wọn ti kọ́kọ́ sẹ àtúnsẹ sí ọrọ̀ ajẹ́.

translation.en: Since then, China's economic size has grown by 90 times.
translation.yo: Lati igba naa, oko owo ilu China ti gbera so ni aadorun igba.

translation.en: For the first time, last year China exported more cars than Germany and surpassed the United States as the biggest market for this industry.
translation.yo: Fún Ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ ní ọdún tó kọjá ní Ṣina fí ọkọ̀ púpọ̀ ránṣẹ́ sí òkè òkun jú Jamani lọ, o tún kọjá Ilu Amerika ni ipò ilu tó ní ọjà tó tóbi jù nínú òwò náà.

translation.en: China's GDP could be larger than the United States within two decades.
translation.yo: GDP ti orile ede China le tobi ju ti orile ede United States lo laarin ogun odun.

translation.en: Tropical Storm Danielle, fourth named storm of the 2010 Atlantic hurricane season, has formed in the eastern Atlantic Ocean.
translation.yo: Tropical Storm Danielle, orúkọ ìjì kẹrin ti ọdún 2010 àkókò ìjì líle Atlantic, ti kórajọ ní ìla oòrùn Atlantic Ocean.

translation.en: The storm, located approximately 3,000 miles from Miami, Florida, has maximum sustained winds of 40 mph (64 kph).
translation.yo: Ìjì líle tó wà ní bí i ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́ta máìlì láti Miami, Florida ti ní atẹ́gùn tótó ogójì mph (64 kph).

translation.en: Scientists at the National Hurricane Center predict that Danielle will strengthen to a hurricane by Wednesday.
translation.yo: Àwọn onímọ̀ ẹ̀rọ ní Ibùdó Ìjì líle Orílẹ̀ èdè sọ àsọtẹ́lẹ̀ pé Danielle ma ní agbára sí ìjì líle tó bá di Wednesday.

translation.en: As the storm is far from landfall, it remains difficult to assess potential impact to the United States or Caribbean.
translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìjì náà ṣe jìnà si à ti dé ilẹ̀, o túbọ̀ ṣòro láti mọ ipa rẹ̀ lórí ilẹ̀ Amẹríkà tàbí Caribbean.

translation.en: Born in the Croatian capital, Zagreb, Bobek gained fame while playing for Partizan Belgrade.
translation.yo: Wọ́n bi ní ìpínlẹ̀ Croatian, Zagreb, Bobek jẹ́ ìlúmọ̀ọ́lá nígbàtí ò ń gbá bọ́ọ̀lù fún Partizan Belgrade.

translation.en: He joined them in 1945 and stayed until 1958.
translation.yo: Ó dara pọ̀ mọ́wọn ní ọdún 1945, ó sì dúró di ọdún 1958.

translation.en: During his time with the team, he scored 403 goals in 468 appearances.
translation.yo: Ní àkókò tó lò pẹ̀lú ikọ̀ náà ó jẹ góòlù mẹ́tàlénírinwó ní ìkópa ọ̀tàlénírinwó ó lé mẹjọ.

translation.en: No one else has ever made more appearances or scored more goals for the club than Bobek.
translation.yo: Kó sẹ́lòmín tó ṣeré jù tàbí jẹ góòlù jù fún ikọ̀ agbábọ̣̀ọ̀lù ju Bobek.

translation.en: In 1995 he was voted the best player in Partizan's history.
translation.yo: Ní 1995 oun ni wọn dìbò fun gégé bi òsèré tí o dárajù nií ìtàn-àkọsílè Partizan.

translation.en: The celebrations started with a special show by the world-renowned group Cirque du Soleil.
translation.yo: Ayẹyẹ náà bẹ̀rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn eré pàtàkì látọwọ́ gbajúgbajù ẹgbẹ́ àgbáyé Cirque du Soleil.

translation.en: It was followed by the Istanbul State Symphony Orchestra, a Janissary band, and the singers Fatih Erkoç and Müslüm Gürses.
translation.yo: Àwọn olórin stanbul State Symphony, àwọn akọrin Janissary àtàwọn olórin Fatih Erkoç tó fi mọ́ Müslüm Gürses ló tẹ̀le.

translation.en: Then Whirling Dervishes took to the stage.
translation.yo: Nígbà tí Whirling Dervishes dé sórí ìtàgé.

translation.en: Turkish diva Sezen Aksu performed with the Italian tenor Alessandro Safina and Greek singer Haris Alexiou.
translation.yo: Arabirin onidan ara Turkeyi - Sezen Aksu seré pẹ̀lú olórin tẹ́nọ̀ tó wá láti Italy Alessandro Safina ati olorin ara Greek singer Haris Alexiou.

translation.en: To finish, Turkish dance group Fire of Anatolia performed the show "Troy".
translation.yo: Níparí, àwọn ẹgbẹ́ oníjó ti Tọ́kì - Iná Anatoliya, ṣe eré “Troyi”.

translation.en: Peter Lenz, a 13-year-old motorcycle racer, has died after being involved in a crash at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway.
translation.yo: Peter Lenz,ọmọ ọdún mẹ́tàlá a fi kẹ̀kẹ́ sáré ìje jáde láyé lẹ́yìn àkọlù tó wáyé ni ojú ọ̀nà márosẹ̀ Indianapolis.

translation.en: While on his warm-up lap, Lenz fell off his bike, and was then struck by fellow racer Xavier Zayat.
translation.yo: Ní àkókò tí ó ń gbáradì, Lenz subu lórí alùpùpù rẹ̀, akẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀, Xavier Zayat sì rọ́ọ̀lú.

translation.en: He was immediately attended to by the on-track medical staff and transported to a local hospital where he later died.
translation.yo: Àwọn onímọ̀ ìlera tó wà ní ojú iṣẹ́ kọjú sí lẹ́sẹ̀kësẹ̀, wọ́n dẹ̀ gbée lọ sí ilé ìwòsàn agbègbè ní ibí tí o ti gbẹ́mímì.

translation.en: Zayat was unhurt in the accident.
translation.yo: Zayat kò farapa ní ibi ìjànmbá ọkọ̀.

translation.en: Regarding the global financial situation, Zapatero continued by saying that "the financial system is a part of the economy, a crucial part.
translation.yo: Nípa ọ̀rọ̀ towódé tò gba gbogbo àgbáyé, Sapatero sì n wípé “ọ̀nà ìṣe owó wà lára ajé, pàápàá èya ara pàtàkì.

translation.en: We have a year-long financial crisis, which has had its most acute moment in the past two months, and I think now the financial markets are beginning to recover."
translation.yo: A ni isoro eto isuna ni nkan bi odun kan seyin, eyi ti o feju keke ni bi osu meji seyin, eyiti mo lero ni bayi wipe ojo isuna ti bere si ni gbera so pada bayi.”

translation.en: Last week, Naked News announced that it would dramatically increase its international language mandate to news reporting, with three new broadcasts.
translation.yo: Ní ọ̀sẹ̀ tó kọjá, ìròyìn Naked News kéde pé òun yó málèkún bá èdè àgbéyé fún ìjábọ̀ ìròyìn pẹ̀lú ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ mẹ́ta tuntun.

translation.en: Already reporting in English and Japanese, the global organization is launching Spanish, Italian, and Korean-language programs, for television, the web, and mobile devices.
translation.yo: Wọ́n ti ń jábọ̀ ní èdè gẹ̀ẹ́sì àti Japan, àjọ àgbáyé ti ń sàfilọ́lẹ̀ ìlàna ètò lédè ilẹ̀ Spain, Italy, àti Korea fún ẹ̀rọ amóhùnmáwòrán, ìtàkù ayélujára àtàwọn ẹ̀rọ ìbáraẹnisọ̀rọ̀.

translation.en: "Luckily nothing happened to me, but I saw a macabre scene, as people tried to break windows in order to get out.
translation.yo: “Orí kómi yọ, ohunkohun kò sẹlẹ̀ sí mi, sùgbọ́n mo rí ìran ikú, bí àwọn ènìyàn se ń gbìyànjú àti fọ́ ojú fèrèsé fi jáde.

translation.en: People were hitting the panes with chairs, but the windows were unbreakable.
translation.yo: Àwọn ènìyàn bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ni ju àga lu fèrèsé, ṣùgbọ́n àwọn fèrèsé náà kò lè fọ.

translation.en: One of the panes finally broke, and they started to get out by the window," said survivor Franciszek Kowal.
translation.yo: Ọ̀kan nínú àwọn gíláàsì fèrèsé padà fọ́, wọ́n sì bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ń gba ojù fèrèsé náà jáde,” Ọ̀kan nínú àwọn tó yè Franciszek Kowal ló sọ bẹ́ẹ̀.

translation.en: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements.
translation.yo: Àwọn ìràwọ̀ ma n taná nítorí agbára tón jáde nígbàtí aidrojini atọ́mu ba papò (tàbí sopọ̀) láti di ẹ́límẹ́ntì tó wúwo.

translation.en: Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way.
translation.yo: Àwọn onímọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ sáyẹ̀nsì ti ń siṣẹ́ láti se àgbékalẹ̀ ohun tó le má a mún agbára wá ní ọ̀nà kan náà.

translation.en: This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.
translation.yo: Amo, Ọ̀rọ yí i ni rọgbọ lati Ṣe, ó ma gbà ọdún púpọ̀ kató rí àpere kíkò riakto ajokanpọ̀.

translation.en: The steel needle floats on top of the water because of surface tension.
translation.yo: Abẹ́rẹ́ onírin fò lórí omi látàrí ọwọ́ lílé ojú omi.

translation.en: Surface tension happens because the water molecules at the surface of the water are strongly attracted to each other more than they are to the air molecules above them.
translation.yo: Surface tension ṣẹlẹ̀ nítorí water molecules ní orí òkè omi fa ara wọn ju bí air molecules lọ eléyìí tó wà ní òkè wọn.

translation.en: The water molecules make an invisible skin on the water’s surface that allows things like the needle to float on top of the water.
translation.yo: Àwọn patikulu náà màa ǹ sẹ àwọn àyè àifojúrí orí ojú omi èyí tí o fàyè gbà àwọn nkan bi abẹ́rẹ́ láti léèfó téńté sórí omi.

translation.en: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted.
translation.yo: Abẹ náà lórí síkààtì yìnyín ìgbàlódẹ́ ní igun olújúmẹ́jì pẹ̀lú ihò róbótó láàrin wọn. Àwọn igi méjèèjì fàyègbà láti di yìnyín mu dada, àní nígbàtí ó bá di títẹ̀.

translation.en: Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves.
translation.yo: Nítorí wípé wọ́n yọgun díẹ̀ sí abẹ́ abẹfẹ́lẹ́, bí abẹfẹ́lẹ́ bá yí sí igun kan tàbí òmíràn, igun èyí tó fatakan yìnyín náà yó yọgun.

translation.en: This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.
translation.yo: Èyí fa kí àwọn tó ń fi ǹkan bí táyà rìn yí, tí ǹkan bí táyà náà bá yí sí apá ọ̀tún, ó ma yí sí apá ọ̀tún, tí ó bá yí sí òsì, ǹkan bí táyà náà ma yí sí òsì.

translation.en: To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light.
translation.yo: Láti padà sí ipò agbára titélè, wọn gbọdọ̀ mú ìfikún agbára èyí tí wọn gba láti ara ìmólẹ̀ kúrò.

translation.en: They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a "photon".
translation.yo: Bi won se ma n seyi nipe won a ma yo ina kekere ti an pe ni “foton.”

translation.en: Scientists call this process "stimulated emission of radiation" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation.
translation.yo: Àwọn onímọ̀ sáyẹ́nsì ma n pè ní “stimulated emission of radiation” torí àwọn átọ́mù ma ń fura sí iná tó ràn èyí ṣokùn fa kí fotoni ina maa jáde,iná dẹ̀ jẹ́ irúfẹ́ redieṣọ́ni.

translation.en: The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture.
translation.yo: Àwòrán tókàn ṣàfihàn atoms tó ń jáde láti photons. Lóòtọ́, ní ojú ayé photons kéré gan jú àwọn tí à ń rí nínu àwòrán.

translation.en: Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!
translation.yo: Àwọn ìwọn iná tún kéré ju àwọn n´ kan tó kórajọ di àwọn ìwọn nkan tó gba àyè tó kéré jùlọ.

translation.en: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works.
translation.yo: Lẹ́yìn ọgarun wákàtí ìṣẹ́ ṣíṣe iná gílóbù ná jó kò sí ṣiṣẹ́ mọ́.

translation.en: The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb.
translation.yo: Gílóòbù tí nílò à ti pààrọ̀. O sé pàtàkì láti kíyè sára bí a bá ń pààrọ̀ gílòbù.

translation.en: First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected.
translation.yo: Àkọ́kọ́, ibí ti a ti ń tan iná ní láti wà ní pípa tàbí kí a yọ gbogbo wáyà iná náà dàn.

translation.en: This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.
translation.yo: Ìdí ni wípé iná tó ń gba ara ihò níbi tí apákan irin tí bọ́ọ̀bù wà le gbé ọ bí o bá fọwọ́ kan inú ihò àbí ti ibùjókòó irin bọ́ọ̀bù nígbàtí apákan rẹ̀ sì wà nínú ihò.

translation.en: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood.
translation.yo: Ẹ̀yà ara pàtàkì fún ìgbẹ́jẹ̀ kiri ni ọkàn, èyí tó má ń pín ẹ̀jẹ̀ káàkiri.

translation.en: Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.
translation.yo: Túùbù tí a mọ̀ sí arteries a máa mú ẹ̀jẹ̀ kúrò nínú ọkàn, nígbàtí túùbù tí a mọ̀ sí isan, a máa mú kí ẹ̀jẹ̀ wọ inú ọkàn. Túùbù tí ó kéré jùlọ ni a mọ̀ sí capillaries.

translation.en: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots.
translation.yo: Eyín ẹranko tí a mọ̀ sí oníwo mẹta kòbá má lè da ewé lásán gé ṣùgbọ́n yóò ba ẹ̀ka àti gbòngbò jẹ.

translation.en: Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous.
translation.yo: Àwọn onímò sayensi kan lérò wípé àwọn ẹronko dáínósọ̀ jẹ àwọn ẹwẹ́ cycads, àwọn ẹwẹ́ tó wọ́pọ̀ nínú ìgbà Cretaceous.

translation.en: These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves.
translation.yo: Àwọn ewé yí jọ igi ọ̀pẹ́ kékeré pẹ̀lú ewé tó gùn jáde tó mú.

translation.en: A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk.
translation.yo: Ẹranko Triceratop oníwo mẹ́ta ti lè lo ęnú rẹ̀ tó le láti ya àwọn ewé kúrò kótó ję ẹ̀yìn igi náà.

translation.en: Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.
translation.yo: Àwọn onímọ̀ sáyẹ̀nsì ti sọ̀ ọ di mímọ̀ pé àwọn ewéko yìí ní oró púpọ̀, torína kò dájú pé ẹran dínósọ̀ kankan má a lè jẹ́ bí b ẹyẹ odídẹrẹ́ ( tó jẹ́ ìran dínósọ̀) ó lè jẹ ewé tàbí èso olóró.

translation.en: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth.
translation.yo: Báwo ni òfin giga ṣe lè fà mí wálẹ̀? tí o bá dúró lórí ohun ti ó rí pẹrẹsẹ, o kò ní níwọ̀n púpọ̀ bí ìgbà tí o dúró lórí aye.

translation.en: A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.
translation.yo: Ẹni tí ó wọn 200 pounds (90kg) ní Ayé ma wọn 36 pounds (16kg). Nítorínà agbára yẹn ma fà ọ́.

translation.en: The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma.
translation.yo: Oorun ko ni erun ti a le duro le lori bi Aye se ni. Gbogbo ara orun ni a se pelu gaasi, ina ati pilasima.

translation.en: The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun.
translation.yo: Afẹ́fẹ́ ma ń tíńrín sí i, bí o bá se n jìnnà sí ààrin òòrùn.

translation.en: The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means "ball of light".
translation.yo: Ibi apá kan níta tí a lè̀rí nígbà tàà bá wo oòrùn ní à ń pè̀ ní àwòrán-àyíká, èyí tó túnmò sí “iná bọlù”.

translation.en: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does.
translation.yo: Níbí ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́ta ọdún tó yá, ní ọdún 1610, awòràwọ̀ ọmọ ilẹ̀ Italy, Galileo Galilei lo ohun amóhuntóbi láti wo bóyá Venus nípele, níbi òṣùpá se ní.

translation.en: Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun.
translation.yo: Ìpelenípele ma ń wáyé nítorí pé igun kan ti Venus (tàbí ti òṣùpá) tó kọjú sí òòrùn ma ń rí ìmọ́lẹ̀. Ìpele Venus sagbátẹrù iṣẹ́ ìwádìí Copernicus tó sọ wípé ayé ń yípo òòrùn.

translation.en: Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.
translation.yo: Nigbanaa, lẹyin ọdun diẹ ni ọdun 1639, ara Gẹẹsi awoirawọ kan to n jẹ Jerimaya Horiki ri irin ajo Fenus.

translation.en: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw.
translation.yo: Orílẹ̀èdè England ti ní ìrírí àlàáfíà ọlọ́jọ́ pípẹ́ lẹ́yìn ìṣẹ́gun ilẹ̀ Danelaw.

translation.en: However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier.
translation.yo: Àmọ́ ní 991 Ẹ́tẹ́rẹ́ẹ̀dì bá ẹgbẹ́ ogun Fáikini pàdé tí ó tóbi jù gbogbo ẹgbẹ́ ogun lọ láti ìgbà tí Gútírùmi tí ó wáyé ní ọgọ́run ọdún tí ó ṣájú.

translation.en: This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination.
translation.yo: Olaf Trygvasson ṣáàjú ọks náà, ará Norway tó ní ọjọ́ ọ̀la láti gba orílẹ̀ èdè rẹ̀ lọ́wọ́ Danish.

translation.en: After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.
translation.yo: Lẹ́yìn ìfàṣẹ́yìn àwọn ológun, Etherlred fohùnsọ̀kan pẹ̀lú Olaf, ẹni tí ó padà sí Norway láti gbìyànjú fi gba ìjọba rẹ̀ padà pẹlù àṣeyọrí tí kò dán mọ́rán.

translation.en: Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450).
translation.yo: Hangooli ni alifabeeti kan soso ti a moomo seda ti a si n lo lojumo. Won seda alifabeeti naa ni 1444 nigbati Oba Sejongi wa lori oye (1418 - 1450.

translation.en: King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded.
translation.yo: Ọba Sejong ni ọba kẹrin ti ìran Joseon ó sì jẹ́ ìkan lára àwọn tí wọ́n bọ̀wọ̀ fún jùlọ.

translation.en: He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means "the correct sounds for the instruction of the people".
translation.yo: Láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ pẹ̀pẹ̀, ohun tí ó sọ alifábẹ́ẹ̀tì Hangeul ni Hunmin Jeongeum, ni èyí tí ó túnmọ̀ sí “ìpohùn àwọn ẹ̀nìyàn tí ó tọ̀nà jùlọ”.

translation.en: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them.
translation.yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ ìmọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ nípa bí Sankrit se bẹ̀rẹ̀ ló wà. Ọkàn lára wọn ni ti asíkiri Aryan láti ìwọ̀ oòrùn lọ sí ilẹ̀ India tó mún èdè wọn wá pẹ̀lu wọn.

translation.en: Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe.
translation.yo: Sanskrit jẹ́ èdè tó ti pẹ́ a sì lè fi wé èdè latin tí wọ́n ma sọ ní Europe.

translation.en: The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy.
translation.yo: Iwe akọkọ ti a mọ ni agbaye ni wọn kọ pẹlu ede Sanskrit. Lẹyin akojọpọ Upanishads, Sanskrit sadede parẹ nitori eto igbelewon.

translation.en: Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.
translation.yo: Ede lile ati aladun ni Sanskriti, o ti wulo gege bi orisun opo ede Indiya igbalode, gege bii ede Latini se je orisun awon ede Yuropi bii Faranse ati Speen.

translation.en: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain.
translation.yo: Bí ogun ilẹ̀ Faransé tí ṣe parí, Germany bẹ̀rẹ̀ si ní gbaradì láti gbógun ti erékùsù ilẹ̀ Britain.

translation.en: Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak.
translation.yo: Jẹmaní pẹ ìnajíjẹ́ àwọn ìkolù náà ní “Isẹ́ Sealion”. Ọmọ ogun IÌú Gẹ̀ẹ́si ti pàdánù ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ohun ìjà àti ìpẹ̀sẹ̀ ikan ogun rẹ nígbàtí o kójádẹo kúrò ní Dunkirk, fún ìdí èyí, ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun náà ti di alàílágbára.

translation.en: But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel.
translation.yo: Ṣùgbọ́n ikọ̀ ológun orí omi Royal ṣì ní agbára ju ikọ̀ ológun orí omi ti Germany lọ (“Kriegsmarine”) Wọ́n sì le borí ìgbógun kí ìgbógun tí ẹkùn Gẹ̀ẹ́sì ìbá gbé wá.

translation.en: However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.
translation.yo: Amọ́ṣá, ìwọ̀nba àwọn ọkọ̀ ojú omi ọlọ́ba ló wà lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ ọ̀nà àkọlù níbí ẹ̀rù se ń ba àwọn ọ̀gágun pé àkọlù ojú òfúrufú ilẹ̀ Germany yíó bo àwọn mọ́lẹ.

translation.en: Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the "little brother" of Germany and Japan.
translation.yo: Ẹ jẹ́ kí á bẹ̀rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú àlàyé ìlànà ilẹ̀ Italy. orílẹ̀èdè Italy ló jẹ́ “àbúrò ọkùnrin” fún ilẹ̀ Germany àti Japan.

translation.en: It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war.
translation.yo: Lóòọ́tọ́ wọ́n sẹ̀sẹ̀ kọ́ àọn ọkọ̀ ojú omi tuntun mẹ́rin sáájú kí ogun tó bẹ̀rẹ̀, ó ní ikọ̀ ológun tí kò lágbára àti àwọn ikọ̀ ológun ojú omi tí kò ra jaja.

translation.en: Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa.
translation.yo: Gbogbo aleba Itili je awon ilu Afirika. Lati ka awon ilu naa mo, won maa nilati ni ibi ti awon ajagun ti le gba lo ja, ki eon lr gba oju Osa Meditereniani lati lo kogun ja Afirika.

translation.en: For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else.
translation.yo: Torí náà, wọ́n ni láti pa ibùdó àt ọkọ̀ ojú omi tí ilẹ̀ Gẹ̀ẹ́sì tó wà ní́ Egypt run . Yàtọ̀ sí àwọn ìgbésẹ̀ wọ̀nyí, kò yẹ́ kí ìjagun ojú omi ilẹ̀ Italy seohunkóhun.

translation.en: Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain.
translation.yo: Nisin fun Japani, orileede irekusu ni Japani je, gege bii Briteeni.

translation.en: Submarines are ships designed to travel underwater, and remain there for an extended amount of time.
translation.yo: ọkọ̀ abẹ́ omi ni àwọn ọkọ̀ ojú omí tí wọn ṣe láti máa rìn ní abẹ́ omi, kí wọ́n sì tún wà ní abẹ́ omí fún ìgbà púpọ̀.

translation.en: Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. Back then they were very slow and had a very limited shooting range.
translation.yo: Wọ́n lo àwọn ọkọ̀ ìjagun ojú omi nínú ogun àgbáyé àkọ́kọ́ àti ogun àgbáyé kejì. Nígbà náà, wọ́n má ń lọ́ra gan won kò sì le yìnbọn níbi tí ó jìnnà.

translation.en: In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen.
translation.yo: Níbẹ̀rẹ̀ ogun wọn sábà rín àjò lọ sí òkè òkun ṣùgbọ́n bí wọn ṣe n ṣẹ̀dá rédà tí ó pé si àwọn ọkọ̀ abẹ́ omi níláti jìn sínú omí kí wọ́n ma baà rí wọn.

translation.en: German submarines were called U-Boats. The Germans were very good at navigating and operating their submarines.
translation.yo: Àwọn ọkọ̀ ìjagun ojú omi ilẹ̀ Germany ni wọ́n ń pè ní U-Boats. Ilẹ̀ Germany dára púpọ̀ nínú à ń tukọ̀ àwọn ọkọ̀ ìjagun ojú omi.

translation.en: Because of their success with submarines, after the war Germans aren't trusted to have many of them.
translation.yo: Nítorí àṣeyọrí wọ́n pẹ̀lú àwọn ọkọ̀ inú omi kékèké, lẹ́yìn tí a kò gbọ́kànlé àwọn ọmọ ogun Germany láti ní púpọ̀ wọn.

translation.en: Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as "King Tut" or "The Boy King", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times.
translation.yo: Bẹ́ẹ̀ni! Ọba Tutankhamun, ti wọ́n fi ìgbà kan pè ní “King Tut” tàbí “ọba àwọn ọkùnrin”, jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára ọba Egypt àtijọ́ tí ó gbajúmọ̀ ní ayé òdi òní.

translation.en: Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists.
translation.yo: Bi ìyanilénu, wọn kò ka kún èyàn Pàtàkì ní àyẹ àtijọ́ wọn o dẹ kọ orúkọ rẹ sílè ni púpọ̀ nínú àwọn àkọsílè ọba àtijọ́.

translation.en: However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed.
translation.yo: Àmọ́ṣá, síse àwárí ibojì rẹ̀ ní 1922 sọ ọ́ di olóòkìkí. Niigbàtí wọ́n ja ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ibojì látẹ̀yìnwá lólè, ibojì yìí nìkan ní wọ́n fi sílẹ̀ láì fọwọ́kàn.

translation.en: Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones.
translation.yo: Wọ́n ti dá ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ohun èlò tí wọ́n sin pẹ̀lú Tutankhamun sí, lára è ní ẹgbẹ̀lẹ́gbẹ̀ iṣẹ́ ọnà tí wọ́n se pẹ̀lú irin àti òkúta tó ṣọ̀wọ́n.

translation.en: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots.
translation.yo: Sísẹ àwárí kèké sọ kèké ogun Assiria di fífúyé, oníjàfáfá, àti dáradára láti sárẹ́ kọja jagunjagun àti kèké ogun míràn.

translation.en: Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry.
translation.yo: ọ̀kọ̀ láti ọrun oró wọn lè wọlé sí ìhámọ́ra ọ̀tá wọn. bíi 1000 B.C, ni àwọn Assyria gbé cavalry àkọ́kọ́ jáde.

translation.en: A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.
translation.yo: Calvary ni a ń pe àwọn ikọ̀́ ọmọ ogun to máa n jà lórí ẹṣin. Ìjòkó ẹ̀yìn ẹṣin kòì tí ì sí ní ìgbà náà, fún ìdí èyí, ẹ̀yìn ẹṣin lásan ni awọn Assyrian máa ń jòkó sí láti jà.

translation.en: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey.
translation.yo: A mọ ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ olóṣèlú, onímọ̀ sayẹnsì, àti òṣèré ilẹ̀ Greek. Ó ṣe é ṣe kí ẹni tí a mọ̀ jùlọ nínú àṣà yìí jẹ́ Homer, ògbọǹtarìgì afọ́jú akéwì, ẹni tí ó ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ ewì méjì kan tí o yááyì tí ó sì gbajúgbajà púpọ̀ nínú lítíréṣọ̀ ilẹ̀ Greek: ewì Iliad àti Odyssey.

translation.en: Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature.
translation.yo: Sopocies àti Aristophanes ṣì jẹ́ gbajúgbajà olùkọ̀wé eré àti pé àwọn eré wọn jẹ́ ìkan lára iṣẹ́ tó tóbi jù lọ ní lítírésọ̀.

translation.en: Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.
translation.yo: Ìlú mọ̀ká ará Gíríkì mìíràn ni Onímọ̀-Ìṣirò Pythagoras, tí ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn mọ̀ fún tíọ́rì rẹ̀ tí o dálórí ìbáṣepọ̀ ẹ̀gbẹ̀gbẹ́ àwọn igun ọ̀tún.

translation.en: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world.
translation.yo: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìsirò iye àwọn èèyàn tó ń sọ èdè Hindi ló wà. Wọ́n sí i wípé ó wà láàrin èdè méjì sí mẹ́rin tí wọ́n ń sọ jùlọ lágbàláaye.

translation.en: The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted.
translation.yo: Oyè àwọn tó gbọ́ èdè ìbílẹ̀ mà n yàtọ̀ ní torí bóyá àwọn a ma n ka àwọn ẹ̀ya èdè to súnmọ́ ara wọ.

translation.en: Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language.
translation.yo: Ìṣirò àwọn tó ma sọ̀rọ̀ jẹ́ láti mílíọ́nù 340 sí mílíọ́nù 500, àti jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ bí mílíọ́nù 800 àwọn ènìyàn lè mọ èdè náà sọ.

translation.en: Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.
translation.yo: Èdè ìperí Hindi àti Urdu jọ ara wọn, ṣùgbọn ìyàtọ̀ wà nínú kíkọ wọn sílẹ̀;Nínú ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ ojoojúmọ́, àwọn olùsọ̀ èdè méjèèjì lè gbọ́ ara wọn yé yéké.

translation.en: Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany.
translation.yo: Ní 15th Century, apá Àríwá Estonia ní ipa àṣà ìlú Germany.

translation.en: Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language.
translation.yo: Awọn ará ilẹ̀ German mú Ọlọ́rún wá súnmọ́ àwọn ẹnìyàn ìbilẹ̀, torí náà wọ́n ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ èdè Estonia.

translation.en: It was based on the German alphabet and one character "Õ/õ" was added.
translation.yo: Nitori alfabeeti Jamani ati okan ni won se fi “Õ/õ” kun.

translation.en: As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment.
translation.yo: Níbí ọjọ́ se ń gorí ọjọ́, ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọ̀rọ̀ tí wọ́n yá láti Germany dirapọ̀ di ọ̀kan. Èyí ni ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ìlàlọ́yẹ̀.

translation.en: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school.
translation.yo: Ní ìlànà àṣà, ajogún ìtẹ yíò dara pọ̀ mọ àwọn ológun lẹ́yìn tó bá keẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tán.

translation.en: However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree).
translation.yo: Àmọ́ṣá, Charles lọ silé ẹ̀kọ́ gíga fásitì ní Trinity College, Cambridge, níbití ó ti kọ́ nípa ẹ̀dá àti àwùjọ àti ìtàn ẹ̀dà, lẹ́yìn èyí ló tún kọ nípa ìtàn, ó pari pẹ̀lu 2:2 (ipò kejì kékeré).

translation.en: Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.
translation.yo: Charles ní Ẹbí Ọba ìlú Òyìnbó àkọ́kọ́ tí yóò gba ìdálọ́lá ìwé èrí dègírì.

translation.en: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country.
translation.yo: Awon alawofunfun ni orile ede Turkey (iwo oorun Thrace tabi Rumelia ni ekun Balkan peninsula) kun 3% awon eeyan orile ede naa.

translation.en: The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape.
translation.yo: Agbègbè ilẹ̀ Turkey gùn ju kìlómítà ẹgbẹ̀jọ (ẹgbẹ̀rún kan mi) àti ìwọ̀n fífẹ̀ ẹgbẹ̀jọ kìlómítà (ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ̀gbẹ̀ta mi), pẹ̀lú igun mẹ́rin.

translation.en: Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe.
translation.yo: Agbègbè Turkey pẹ̀lú adágún gba bí i ààyè ọ̀rìn lé lẹ́ẹ̀dẹ́gbẹ̀rin ó lé mẹ́ta ẹgbẹ̀rún onígun mẹ́rin kìlómítà (300,948 sq mi),nínú èyí tí ọ̀tà lé lẹ́ẹ̀dẹ́gbẹ̀rin ó dín márùn ún ẹgbẹ̀rún ó lé ọ̀rìn lé lẹ́gbẹ̀ta ó lé mẹ́jọ onígun mẹ́rin kìlómítà (291,773 sq mi) ló wà ní ẹkùn ìwọ̀ oòrùn gúúsù Asia àti ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́tàlélógún, ọ̀tà lé lẹ́ẹ̀dẹ́gbẹ̀rin ó lé mẹ́rin onígun mẹ́rin kìlómítà (9,174 sq mi) in Europe.

translation.en: Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined.
translation.yo: Agbẹ̀gbẹ̀ Turkey jẹ́ orílé-èdè ẹ̀kẹtàdínlógójí ní tìtòbi, o jẹ iyẹ ìwọ̀n olú ílu Faransé àti ílu ọba lápapò.

translation.en: Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.
translation.yo: Orile ede Turkey je eyiti okun nla meta yi ka: okun Aegean ni apa iwo oorun, Okun Dudu ni ariwa ati Okun Medirettanean ni apa ila oorun.

translation.en: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839.
translation.yo: Luxembourg ní ìtàn tó gùn ṣùgbọ́n déètì òmìnira rẹ láti 1839..

translation.en: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
translation.yo: Ibi tí a mọ̀ ní Belgium jẹ́ ara apá Luxembourg látẹ̀yìnwá, sùgbọ́n ó di Belgian lẹ́yìn ogun ìgbàjọba Belgian ní ọdún 183.

translation.en: Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany.
translation.yo: Lusemboogi ti gbiyanju lati je orileede ti kii da si oro sugbon ni Ogun Agbaye Ikini Ati Ikeji, Jamani fi agbara gba won.

translation.en: In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.
translation.yo: Ni 1957 Lusembogi di omoegbe ipile igbimo ti a n pe ni Apapo Yuropi.

translation.en: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village).
translation.yo: Drukgyal Dzong jẹ́ odi tí ó ti bàjẹ́ àti iléègbé àwọn mọ́ǹkì Buddhist ní òkè agbègbè Para (ní abúlé Phondey.

translation.en: It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces.
translation.yo: Wọ́n sọ ọ́ di mímọ̀ pé lọ́dun 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel sèdásílẹ̀ odi láti fi sèrántí ìṣẹ́gun rẹ̀ tako ikọ̀ ológun Tibetan-Mongol.

translation.en: In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal.
translation.yo: Ní ọdún 1951, ìjàm̀bá iná sàkọlù sáwọn ohun atọ́kasí ìtàn tó sẹ́kù ní Drukgyal Dzong, bí i àwòrán Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal.

translation.en: After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.
translation.yo: Lẹ́yìn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ iná, wọ́n dá ààbò bo àgọ́ náà, bẹ́ẹ̀ni wọ́n pa á mọ́, èyí tó mún un jẹ́ ọ̀kan gbòógì ohun afanimọ́ra ní ìlú Bhutan.

translation.en: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam.
translation.yo: Ní sẹ́ńtúrì kejìdínlógún, wọ́n rí Cambodia níbi tí wọ́n fún un sí láàrin àwọn agbègbè méjì, Thailand àti Vietnam.

translation.en: The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen.
translation.yo: Àwọn ara Thai wolé sí Cambodia lára ní ọ̀pọ̀ ìgbà ni sẹńtúrì kejìdínlógún àti ni ọdún 1772, wọ́n siba Phnom Phen jẹ́.

translation.en: In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.
translation.yo: Ní àwọn ọdun aipẹ julọ century 18 náà àwọn eniyan ti Vietnam gbógun ti Cambodia.

translation.en: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy.
translation.yo: Ìdá méjìdílógún àwọn èèyàn ilẹ̀ Venezuela ni kò ní iṣẹ́, ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn tó sì níṣẹ́ ló ń siṣẹ́ ní ẹka ọrọ̀ ajé tí kìí se fọ́mà.

translation.en: Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture.
translation.yo: Ìdá mẹ́ta àwọn ènìyàn ilẹ̀ Venezuela tó ń siṣẹ́ ló wà lẹ́ka tó ń pèsè iṣẹ́, ìdá mẹ́ta wà ní ilé- iṣẹ́ nígbàtí ìkọrùn ún wà lẹ́ka tó ń rí sí ohun ọ̀gbìn.

translation.en: An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.
translation.yo: Ilé iṣẹ́ to ṣe pàtàkì ní ilé iṣẹ́ epo Venezuelans jẹ́, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ìdá kan nínú àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè ló ń ṣiṣẹ níbẹ̀.

translation.en: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City.
translation.yo: Nínú ìwé ìròyìn olómìnira àpapọ̀, ọgbà ewéko to wà ní Singapore ní àwọn akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ ti ṣe ìrànlọ́wọ́ láti sọ erékùsù di ìlú tígi pọ̀ sí jù.

translation.en: In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.
translation.yo: Ní ọdún 1981,Vanda Miss Joaquim, wọ́n mún èso orchid gẹ́gẹ́ bí i òdòdó àpapọ̀.

translation.en: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains.
translation.yo: Ní nǹkan bí i osù kẹwàá ọdọọdún ni àwọn ẹranko tó ń jẹ ewé tíye wọ́n tó mílíọ̀nù kan ó lé ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbẹ̀ta ma ń rìnrìn àjò lọ sí ẹkùn gúúsù, fo odò Mara láti àwọn òkè àríwá fún òjò.

translation.en: And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April.
translation.yo: Nìgbàtí wọ́n padà sí àríwá nípasẹ̀ ìwọ oòrùn, lẹ́ẹ̀kan si nígbàtí wọ́n gba odò Mara kọjá, lẹ́yìn àkókò òjò ní oṣù kẹrin.

translation.en: The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.
translation.yo: Agbon ti Serengeti se akopo Serengeti National Park, Ngoromgoro Conservative Area ati Maswa Game Reserve ni orile’de Tanzania ati Maasai Mara NAtional Reserve ti Kenya.

translation.en: Learning to create interactive media requires conventional and traditional skills, as well as tools mastered in interactive classes (storyboarding, audio and video editing, story telling, etc.)
translation.yo: Kíkọ́ láti ṣẹ̀da ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ alájọsọ nílò́ àwọn ohun ìbára-ẹni-sọ̀rọ̀ àti àwọn nǹkan abínibí, àti pẹ̀lú láti ni di ògbóntarìgì nihnú ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ onílànà ìbara-ẹni sọ̀rọ̀ (sísọ̀tàn-pẹ̀lú-pátákò, ṣíṣe àtúntò àwọn ohùn àti ffọ́nrán amóhùnmáwòrán, sísọ ìtàn, abbl.)

translation.en: Interactive design requires that you re-assess your assumptions about media production and learn to think in a non-linear ways.
translation.yo: Àgbékalẹ̀ Ibara-ẹni-ṣepọ̀ nílò pé kí a tún èrò wa yẹ̀wò nípa ìgbéjáde ayélujára, kí a sì kọ́ láti ronú ní ọ̀nà ọ̀tọ.

translation.en: Interactive design requires that components of a project connect to each other, but also make sense as a separate entity.
translation.yo: Àgbékalẹ̀ ìbáraẹnisọ̀rọ̀ pè fú kí àwọn ẹka àkànṣe iṣẹ́ lọ́pọ̀ mọ́ra wọn sùgbọ́n ó tún mọ́pọlọ lọ́wọ́ bí wọ́n bá wà lẹ́yọkọ̀ọ̀kan.

translation.en: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses.
translation.yo: Nkan tí ò dáa nipa lensì soomì nipé agbára rẹ láti dájúle nkan àti oye lensì tó nilò láti rí ìdójúké oyé púpọ̀ o ti pọ̀jù tí lensì primu.

translation.en: This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production.
translation.yo: Kii se isoro pupo mo nitori pe awon to n se lensi ti n se aseyori ni iselopo lensi.

translation.en: This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length.
translation.yo: Èyí jẹ́ kí lẹ́nsì tó lè ṣàmùgbòrò láti gbé àwọn ojúlówó àwòrán jáde k;i a fi wé lẹ́nsì tó jé pé kò lè ṣe àmúgbòrò àwòrán.

translation.en: Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower.
translation.yo: Àléébù mìíràn tí lẹ́ǹsì àwosúnsún nipé bi ihò bà ṣe tóbi sí (bí o ṣe yára sí ) bẹẹni lẹ́ǹsì lọ́pọ̀ ìgbà yíò sì kéré sí .

translation.en: This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.
translation.yo: Èyí mún kí àwọn àwo amúnìkangbòòrò nira láti lò níbi tí òòye kò ti pọ̀ láìsí ìtànsán.

translation.en: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan.
translation.yo: Òkan lára àwọn ìṣòro tó wọ́pọ̀ nígbà tí ènìyàn ń gbìyànjú láti yí sinima padà sí èrò DVD ni ìṣújù .

translation.en: Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public.
translation.yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ ẹ̀rọ amóhùnmáwòrán ni wọ́n ṣẹ̀dá láti tẹ́ àwọn ará ìlú lọ́rùn.

translation.en: For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides.
translation.yo: Fun idi eyi, gbogbo nkan ti o ba n ri lori amohunmaworan ni won ge ala okoe, isale ati egbegbe re kuro.

translation.en: This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan.
translation.yo: Èyí ni láti ri wípé àwòrán náà bo gbogbo ìbòjú. Òhun ni wọ́n ń pè ní ìṣíjú.

translation.en: Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.
translation.yo: Ó ṣeni láàánú pé tí o bá ṣe DVD, eteti rẹ náà ṣe é ṣe kí ó gé kúrò pẹ̀lú, tí fídíò náà bá ní àdàkọ sií èdè mìíràn tí o sì súnmọ́ abẹ́, wọn ò ní hàn dáadáa.

translation.en: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry.
translation.yo: Ilé ńlá oníṣe àtijọ́ ti sàgbélárugẹ ìwòye ojú inú, sàkójọ̀ àwòrán akọni, ayẹyẹ, àti àwọn olóyè Arthur.

translation.en: Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits.
translation.yo: Kódá dídúró láàrin ìparun ẹgbẹ̀rún ọdún, ó rọrùn láti fi ìró àti òórùn ogun ọjọ́ pípẹ̀ sọ́kàn, débí gbígbọ́ gbùgbùgbù ẹsẹ ẹranko lórí òkúta àti gbígbọ́ òórùn ẹ̀rù tó jáde látinú ọ̀gbun.

translation.en: But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?
translation.yo: Ṣùgbọ́n ṣé ìwoṣàkun wa dá lórí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ojú ayé bi? Kí ló dé tí wọ́n ń kọ ilé ìṣọ́ gan an? Báwo ni wọ́n ṣe yà wọ́n, tí wọ́ sì kọ́ wọn?

translation.en: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle.
translation.yo: Bí àsìkò yìí ṣe rí nìyẹn, Kirby Muxloe Castle jọ ilé tí wọ́n tò dáadáa ju ilé ìṣọ́ l.

translation.en: Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long.
translation.yo: Ferese nla re ti won kun ati ogiri re to tirin on ni le duro pe ti won ba diidi doju ija ko.

translation.en: In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.
translation.yo: Ní àwọn ọdún 1480, nígbàtí kíkọ́ rẹ bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti ọwọ́ Lord Hastings, orílè-èdè náà ní àlàáfíà díè àti pe ìwúlò wà fún ìdábòbò lòdì sí àwọn ikọ́ ogun alárìnká kékèké.

translation.en: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states.
translation.yo: Ìsedédé agbára ni ètò tí ilẹ̀ Europu ń lò láti fi se ìsàkóso ìjẹgàba àpapọ̀ àwọn orílẹ̀ Europu lápapọ.

translation.en: The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance.
translation.yo: Èróngbà ni pé gbogbo orílẹ̀ èdè Europe níláti wà láti lè dènà orílẹ̀ èdè kan láti má ní agbára, àti pé ìjọba ma ń yí ọ̀rẹ́ wọn kí wọ́n bá lè ní ìwọ̀ntúnwọ̀nsí.

translation.en: The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power.
translation.yo: Ogun Igbapò ilẹ̀ Spain ni ó jẹ́ alákọ̀ọ́kọ́ tí yóò dá lórí dídọ́gba agbára.

translation.en: This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.
translation.yo: Eleyi jẹ apẹẹrẹ ti o ṣe pataki, bi awọn alagbara alawọ funfun ko ṣe ni ma lugọ sẹyin ogun ẹsin mọ. Bẹẹni, Ogun Ọlọgbọn Ọdun naa ni yio jẹ eyi ti o gbẹyin ti a o pẹ ni ogun ẹsin.

translation.en: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus.
translation.yo: Tẹ́ḿpìlì Artemis ní Éfésù di pípa run ní Oṣù Keje, ọdún 356 BCE ìjàmbá iná tí Herostratus dá silesílè.

translation.en: According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded.
translation.yo: Bi itan naa se wi, nkan to fi se iwuri nip e ko je gbajumo ni onakona. Awon ara Efesu, won ti binu, won kede pe ki won ma ko oruko Erostratusi lai lai.

translation.en: The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born.
translation.yo: Asọ̀tàn Greek padà wá kọ orúkọ náà, èyí tí a ma lọ́nìí. Wọ́n wó ilé àdúrà náà ní alé náà tí wọ́n bí Alexander the great.

translation.en: Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.
translation.yo: Alexander, gẹ́gẹ bi ọba pinu láti sanwó fún àtúnkọ́ tẹ́ḿpìlì náà sùgbọ́n a kò gba ìpinu rẹ láàyè. Lẹ́yìna, ikú Alexander, tẹ́ḿpìlì náà di àtúnkọ ní 323 BCE.

translation.en: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers.
translation.yo: Rí i dájú pé ọwọ́ rẹ ní ìsinmi bó se yẹ nígbàtí o bá ń kọlu gbogbo àkíyèsí tí ó tó - pẹ̀lú pé ki o má dààmú ọmọ ìka ọwọ́ rẹ jùlọ.

translation.en: This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano.
translation.yo: Bó ba n ṣe báyí kò ní rẹ̀ ẹ́ jù. Rántí pé o kò níláti fi agbára tẹ ojú rẹ̀ kí ohun rẹ̀ ga síi bí ti piano.

translation.en: On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.
translation.yo: Láti mú ohun akodioni tóbi si wàá lò àwọn belò pẹ̀lú agbára tàbí ere sí i.

translation.en: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God.
translation.yo: Ìgbàgbọ́ Mysticism ní síse àwárí ajọsepọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìdánimọ̀ tàbí ìmọ̀lára ìdánilójú gbòógì, ìdẹ́ẹ̀dá, òtítọ́ ẹ̀mí tàbi Ọlọ́run.

translation.en: The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties.
translation.yo: Àwọn onígbàgbọ́ máa ń wa ìríri tààrà́, ìmọ̀́lára tàbí fi ojú inú wo ohun tótọ́ ti ọ̀run tàbí àwọn alálẹ̀ òrìsà.

translation.en: Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences.
translation.yo: Àwọn agbátẹ̀lé ma n tẹ́lẹ̀ àwọn ìlànà àti ìgbésí ayé kan tó ma n jẹ́kí àwọn ìrírí yẹn rẹ̀ si.

translation.en: Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.
translation.yo: Misticisimi da yato laarin awon esin miin ati ona ijosin, toripe o tenumo iriri tara eni ni ipo imo ohun to dayato, paa paa julo awon to niwa suuru, ironu jinle, alayo abi idun.

translation.en: Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition.
translation.yo: Sikhism je esin awon ara iha India. O bere lati agbegbe Punjab ni senturi 15th laarin awon eya ti o pin ninu asa awon Hindu.

translation.en: Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions.
translation.yo: Àwọn Síìkì gbàgbó pé ẹ̀sìn wọn ò sí lára Induisimi ṣùgbọ́n wọ́n gbà pé Síìkì wá láti àṣà àti ìṣe Indù.

translation.en: Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for "way of the guru". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs.
translation.yo: Àwọn Sikhs ń pe ẹ̀sìn wọn ní Gurmat, èyí tí wọ́n pè ní Punjabi “nílànì àwọn guru”. Àwọn guru ní ẹ̀sìn àkọ́kọ́ gbogbo ẹ̀sìn Indian àmọ́ Sikhism ti di pàtàkì èyí tí ó jẹ́ pàtàkì ìgbàgbọ́ Sikh.

translation.en: The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus.
translation.yo: Wọ́n sèdásílẹ̀ ẹ̀sìn náà ní sẹ́ńtu (1469–1539).

translation.en: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism.
translation.yo: Àmọ́ ní Okudu 1956, a dán àwọn ìlérí Kruṣẹ́fì wò nígbà rogbodiyan ní Polandi m, tí àwọn oṣiṣẹ́ ń takò àìsí oúnjẹ́, ìdínkù owó iṣẹ́, tó dí rogbodiyan gbogbogbò láti takò Komunisimi.

translation.en: Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.
translation.yo: O kàn jẹ́ pé ni òpin, Krushchev fi àgbá ráṣẹ́ fún àwọn tí wọ́n ń béèrè ọjà, ó fi ààyè sílẹ̀ fún àwọn ohun th iètò ọrọ̀ ajé fẹ́ ó sì gbà láti fi gbajúgbajà náà Wladyslaw Gomulka jẹ Ẹmẹ̀wà tuntu.

translation.en: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan.
translation.yo: Ní àárin gbùngùn Indus, Ọ̀làjú jẹ́ àkókò Bronze Age, ọlàjú ní àríwá-ìwọ̀oòrùn India fi ara pẹ́ ọ̀pọ̀ ti òde òní tí ó wà ní Pakistan àti àwọn agbègbè ní Aríwá-ìwọ̀oòrùn Afghanista.

translation.en: The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name.
translation.yo: Olàjú náà gbilẹ̀ nínú Iyàwòomiòkun sínú ilé tí odò Indus níbití orúkọ rẹ tí gbẹjẹyọ .

translation.en: Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.
translation.yo: Biotilejepe awon omowe kan daba pe nitori pe awon ara besini Odo Sarasfati to ti wa gbe laju, o ye ki won pe ni Olaju Indus-Sarasfati, awon kan maa n pe ni Olaju Harapani, akoko ninu awon ibi ti won wu jade ni 1920s.

translation.en: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances.
translation.yo: Ìjẹ́ ológun ilẹ̀ Roman sèrànwọ́ fún ìdàgbàsóke ètò ìsègùn òyìnbó.

translation.en: Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles.
translation.yo: Ọba Augustus gbàwọn onímọ̀ ìsègùn òyìnbó, bakanáà lótún sàgbékalẹ̀ ikọ̀ onísègùn ilẹ̀ Róòmùn àkọ́kọ́ láti lò lẹ́yìn ogun.

translation.en: Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds.
translation.yo: Àwọn oníṣẹ́abẹ nímọ̀ lórí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ òògun oorun nínú èyí tí mọfìnì tí wọ́n se látara àyọkúrò kóró pọ́pì àti scopolamine latara àwọn kóró àgbo.

translation.en: They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow.
translation.yo: Wọ́n di akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ ògbóntarìgì nínú kí a gé ẹsẹ̀/apá láti dóòlà ẹ̀mí àwọn aláìsàn, bẹ́ẹ̀ náà ni wọn a tún máa ṣe àtọwọ́dá ọwọ/ẹsẹ̀ láti lè dá ẹ̀jẹ̀ dúró.

translation.en: Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.
translation.yo: Ni opo senturi, ijoba Roomu dari si ere nla ninu owo iwosan oun lo de papa di pupo ninu imo ti a ni loni.

translation.en: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations.
translation.yo: Títẹ ìwẹ́ ní ọ̀nà tọ dánsáká ni ìwẹ́ títẹ̀ oni gbẹ̀dẹ́kẹ pèlú sísẹ títè kan ṣoṣo lèèkàn náà, kò fàyàgbà àwọn ọ̀nà ìwẹ títẹ̀ tọ ṣòro bi aládáàpadàsẹ́yìn, áti wípé gbogbo títẹ̀ ni o sẹẹsẹ tààrà.

translation.en: It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.
translation.yo: John Smith ló dasílẹ̀ ní 1970 láti ran fódà tí kò nú ìrírí lọ́wọ́ tàbí àwọn tí kò mọ ọkọ̀ wà dáadáa.

translation.en: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior.
translation.yo: Àwọn ọmọdé ma ń ní ìmọ̀lára orísun àti ìhùwàsí ti nípa ẹléyàmẹ̀yà yìí máa ń ní ìpalára fún ìhùwàsí.

translation.en: For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.
translation.yo: Fun apẹẹrẹ, awọn ọmọ ti wọn damọ si ẹya to kere ti o si gbagbọ pe awọn kole se dada ni ile iwe,nitori naa ni wọn ki fi se dada ni ile iwe nitori igbagbọ wọn to so mọ eya wọn.

translation.en: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently.
translation.yo: MySpace ni òpó weebu tó lókìkí kẹta jùlọ ni orílè-èdè Améríkà o si ni èrìnlélàádọ́ta millionu prófáílì lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́.

translation.en: These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting.
translation.yo: Àwọn ojú òpó weebu wònyí ti ní àkíyèsí púpọ̀, ní pàtàkì ní agbọn ètò èkó.

translation.en: There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features.
translation.yo: Anfani wa lori awon saiti wonyi bii o seese lati da oju iwe weebu kilasi sile to le ni blogi, fidio ati awon aworan ati awon eroja miin.

translation.en: This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling.
translation.yo: O lè ráyèsí ojú ìwé yìí nípa pípèsè àdírẹ́sì wkẹ̀bù kan, èyí tó jẹ́ kó rọrùn láti rántí tó dẹ̀ rọrùn láti tẹ̀ fún àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tó lé ní ìdàmú nínu lílo keyboard tàbí pẹ̀lú sípẹ̀lì.

translation.en: It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.
translation.yo: Àkànse lè ba láti mún un kó rọrùn láti ka àti pẹ̀lú àwọ̀ díẹ̀ tàbí iye tí wọ́n bá fẹ́.

translation.en: Attention Deficit Disorder "is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy".
translation.yo: Attention Deficit Disorder, ni ààrùn ọpọlọ tí o máa ń fa kí ènìyàn máa ní àwọn àpẹẹrẹ bí wérewère, wọ́nranwọ̀nran, ránhunràun, àti wàìwàì tàbí gànràngànrà.”

translation.en: It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it "affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children".
translation.yo: Kìn ṣe àìkè kọ́ ẹ̀kọ́, bí kò ṣe ṣìṣe ségeṣège ní ẹ̀kọ́ kíkọ́, ó ma ń nípa lórí 3-5 percent gbogbo àwọn ọmọdé, kódà mílíọ́nù méjì àwọn ọmọ kékèké ìlú Amékíkà.

translation.en: Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation.
translation.yo: Awon omode to ni ADD, o ma n soro fun won lati fokan si nkan bii ise ile iawe sugboon wo le fokan si awon nkan to ba wu won bii ere sise abi wiwo ere katooni ti won feran julo abi kiko gbolohun lai lo awon ami gbolohun.

translation.en: These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they "engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods.
translation.yo: Àwọn ọmọ wọ̀nyí le dojúkọ ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìsòro nítorí wọn a máà “wu àwọn ìwà tó léwu, kópa nínú jàgídíjàkan, àti ìsọ̀dì sòfin” láti lè se ìwúrí fún ọpọlọ wọn, níwọn ìgbà tí ọpọlọ wọn kò lè sisẹ́ ìwúrí lónà déédéé.

translation.en: ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different.
translation.yo: ADD ma n ní ipá lóri ibasepo pẹ̀lú àwọn ëgbẹ́ min tori pe awon omode o le mo idi ti won fi n se bi won se ma n se tabi idi ti won fi n pe oro bi won se ma n pe tabi pe idagbasoke won yato.

translation.en: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed.
translation.yo: Níbí àyípadà se bá agbára àti ní ìmọ̀ òhun ìkẹ́ẹ̀kọ́ lọ́nà tó ju àlàkalẹ̀ lọ tí wọ́n fi ń kọ́ nipa ìmọ̀ lọ.

translation.en: The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus.
translation.yo: Bí a ṣe lè gba ìwífún yàtọ̀. Mi kò ṣe mọ́. Àfetígbọ́ wà nínu olúkúlùkù, ṣùgbọ́n agbára láti rántí jẹ́ ǹkan tó yẹ kí a mú ní ọ̀kúnkúndùn.

translation.en: In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.
translation.yo: Ní àkótán, ọ̀làjú náà se àyípadà pàtàkì sí ilànà ẹ̀kọ́ àti ìtànkálẹ̀ ìmọ̀.

translation.en: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees.
translation.yo: Yàtọ̀ sí àwọn primeeti òmíràn àwọn ominiidi o ki fọwọ́ rìn tàbí gbẹ́rù tàbí gun igi.

translation.en: The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking.
translation.yo: Ọwọ́ àti ẹsẹ̀ ìnànkí náà dọ́gba ní íwọ́n tìtòbi áti gígùn, o sàfihàn pe ọwọ́ náà ni wón fi n gbéra bí wọ́n se rìn lórí ọwọ́́.

translation.en: The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges.
translation.yo: Ọwọ́ ènìyàn kéré sí ẹsẹ̀ rẹ̀, pẹlù eegun ẹsẹ̀ tí ó tọ́.

translation.en: Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.
translation.yo: Àwọn egungun ọwó ohun àlùmọ́ọ́nì fún mílíọ̀nù ọdún méjì safihàn àyípadà pàtàkì ọwó láti lílò ipò sí ìfowóyí .

translation.en: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting.
translation.yo: Àwọn èyàn wà tó gbàgbọ́ pé àlákálà lọ́pọ̀jù ma n ma n jẹ́ kó rę èyàn.

translation.en: The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states.
translation.yo: Ìdí gbòógì fú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí ni àbájáde àwọn ààlá tó hàn kedere fún nínawọ́jà gígùn àkókò láàrin àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ REM tó sẹ́kù.

translation.en: With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem.
translation.yo: Tí REMs bá dínkù ní alẹ́ kan, ipò yii tí oti ń rí orun sùn, àti dídánara rẹ kò ni dán mọ́ ọn ran mọ́ láti di ìṣòr.

translation.en: This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV.
translation.yo: Eyi je ki o re ara bi eni wipe eniyan nilo lati ma ji iseju ogun si ogbon lera-lera lati wo ero mohunmaworan.

translation.en: The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.
translation.yo: Àbájádẹ yìí dálé lórí bí ọpọlọ rẹ se n sakitiyan láti la àlá kẹdẹrẹ ní alẹlẹ́.

translation.en: Things did not go well for the Italians in North Africa almost from the start. Within a week of Italy's declaration of war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars had seized Fort Capuzzo in Libya.
translation.yo: Nnkan kò lọ dáadáa fún àwọn ará ilẹ̀ Italy ní ẹkùn àríwá ilẹ̀ adúláwọ̀ láti ìbẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀. Láàárin ọ̀ṣẹ̀ kan tí ilẹ̀ Italy síde ogun ni ọjọ kẹwa ọṣù kẹfà ọdún 1940, British kọkànlá Hussars ti fipá gba Fort Capuzzo ni Libya.

translation.en: In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Tenth Army's Engineer-in-Chief, General Lastucci.
translation.yo: Ní ìbániníbùba ní ìlà-òrùn Bardia, àwọn ara IÌú Gẹ̀ẹ́si mu olórí Amojú-Ẹ̀rọ Ìpín-Kẹ̀wá Italian, General Lastucci.

translation.en: On June 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, the Governor-General of Libya and apparent heir to Mussolini, was killed by friendly fire while landing in Tobruk.
translation.yo: Ní oṣù kẹfà ọjọ́ 28, Mashal Ìalo Balbo, Governor General ti ìlú Libya àti ajogún Mussolini, ní inà tí kò léwu pa nígbàtí ó ń basílẹ̀ ní Tobruk.

translation.en: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition.
translation.yo: Wọ́n lè ṣeré eré ìdárayá ìjà ẹlẹ́ni mẹ́ta ìgbàlódé ní ìpele méta, láti akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tó wà ní ilé ẹ̀kọ́ àgbà sí àkọ́ṣkmọṣẹ́ àti ìdíje Olympics.

translation.en: The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.
translation.yo: Meji meji ni won ma n gba ere idaraya na, fensa kan n du elomiin.

translation.en: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes.
translation.yo: Eré Gọ́ọ̀fù jẹ́ eré táwọn eléré ńlò kílọ̀bù fi gbá bọ́ọ̀lù sínú ihò.

translation.en: Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth.
translation.yo: Wọn fi ihò méjìdínlọ́gún ṣeré ní abala tó wọ́pọ̀, pẹ̀lú àwọn òṣèrè tó má bẹ́rẹ́ pẹ̀lú ihò àkọ́kọ́ ní abala yẹn tó sì parí lórí oní méjìdínlógún.

translation.en: The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins.
translation.yo: Òṣèrè tó wẹ omi díẹ̀, tàbí mú orí ẹgbẹ́ rl wù, láti parí ìdíje náà.

translation.en: The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.
translation.yo: Orí koróko ni wọ́n tí ń se eré náà, àti pé wọ́n má ń gé koríko tó wà ní ẹ̀bá ihò kúrú èyí tí wọ́n ń pè ní àwọ̀ ewéko.

translation.en: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism.
translation.yo: Bóyá ìrìn àjò afẹ́ tó wọ́ pọ̀jù lọ ní ní èyi tí àwọn èyàn ma ń kà mọ́ ìrìn àjò: ìrìn àjò ìdárayá.

translation.en: This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun.
translation.yo: Èyí ni bí àwọn èèyàn bá lọ sí ibìkan tó yàtọ̀ sáwọn ibi tó yàtọ̀ sí ìgbé aué òòjọ́ wọn láti lọ gbádùn , se fàájì ara wọn.

translation.en: Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists.
translation.yo: Ẹtí òkun, ọgbà ńlá àti àwọn ìpàgọ́ jẹ́ ibí tí àwọn arìnrìn-àjò-afẹ́ máa ń rin jùlọ.

translation.en: If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism.
translation.yo: Tí èróngbà ìbẹ̀wò sí ibi kan ní láti mọ̀ nípa ìtàn rẹ̀ ati àṣà rẹ̀ á jẹ́ pé ìrún àbẹ̀wò yìí ní a lè pè ní àbẹ̀wò aláṣà.

translation.en: Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.
translation.yo: Awọn olubẹwo arinrinajo le ṣe abẹwo si oriṣiriṣi ibi ti o ba ṣe pataki ni orilẹ ede kan tabi ki wọn yan lati dojukọ ibikan pato.

translation.en: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements.
translation.yo: Awon amunisin, nigbati won ri isele ti o sele, ti pe fun iranlowo.

translation.en: Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals).
translation.yo: Àwọn ọmọ ogun tí o ń fi agbára kún lílọ síwájú pẹ̀lú ìlànà ìpín ìkíní àti ìkẹta New Hampshirs pẹ̀lú igba ọmọ ogun lábé olùsọ John Stark àti James Reed (tí àwọn méjèèjì sì padà di ọgagun nígbà tó yá.

translation.en: Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position.
translation.yo: Lórí ọ̀rọ̀ àwọn amúnisìn, tó wà ní ààlà tí ó kángun ní àríwá ni àwọn ọkùnrin Stark fi ìkàlẹ̀ s.

translation.en: When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach.
translation.yo: Nigbati sisan omi ya egbe kan lule ni ojusan odo Mystic lona ariwa Peninsula,ni kiakia ni won mo gegele pelu okuta ni ariwa eyiti o fori so adagun kekere kan.

translation.en: Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.
translation.yo: Gridley tàbí Stark gbé gègé bí i ìwọn ẹsẹ̀ ọgọ́rùn ún (ọgbọ̀n mítà) níwájú ósì pàṣẹ pé wọn kò gbọdọ̀ tanná títí tí òfin déédé yóó fi gùn ún.

translation.en: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions.
translation.yo: Ètò ìlú Amerika gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé kíkọjú ìjàkadì láti ibi ọ̀tọ̀tọ̀ mẹ́ta.

translation.en: General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements.
translation.yo: Ọ̀gágun John Cadwalder ma ṣàfilọ́lẹ̀ ìkọlù ìyàtọ̀ tó lòdì sí British garrison ní Bordentown, láti lè dínà fún ìrànlọ́wọ́.

translation.en: General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping.
translation.yo: Ọ̀gágun James Ewing yóò kó ọmọ ológun ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbẹ̀rin fo oi tó wà ní Trenton Ferry, gba afárá lórí Odọ̀ Assunpinki, gbégi rénà ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ kí wọ́n má lè sá.

translation.en: The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.
translation.yo: Àwọn ikọ̀ ajagun tí okùnrin ẹgbẹ̀rún méjì ó lé irinwó máa la odò máìlì mẹ́san ní apá àríwá Trenton kọjá, wọ́n á sì pín sí ọ̀wọ̣́ méjì; ọ̀kan lábę Greene àti ọ̀kan láẹ́ Sullivan, láti lè se àkọlù kílẹ̀ tó mọ́.

translation.en: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity.
translation.yo: Pẹ̀lú àyípadà eré sísá láti ìdámẹ́ta sí ìdá méjì máìlì, yíyára dí ohun tí kò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ wúlò lọ́pọ̀ tí ìfaradà sì di dandan.

translation.en: Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards.
translation.yo: Bẹ́ẹ̀ni, ògbóǹragìrì onídajì máìlì, ọkùnrin tó lè na ìṣẹ́jú méjì, ó gbọ́dọ̀ ní iye ìrìn tó tó lẹ́sẹ̀, àmọ́ ìfàyàrán gbọ́dọ̀ wà ní fún gbogbo ewu.

translation.en: Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.
translation.yo: Àwọn orílẹ̀èdè kan máa ń sáré ní àsìko òtútù, tí wọn a sì paápọ̀ mọ́ ìgbáradì fún erésísa láti jẹ́ kí ara wọn wuyì lókè, ẹ̀yí ni ìgbáradì ti ó dára jùlọ fún ìdíje eré sísá.

translation.en: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness.
translation.yo: Síse àwọn àsà asarelóore lásán kò le ní sagbẹ́tẹrù eréje tó dára jù, àmọ́ ó lè nípa lórí ìjípépé àwọn ọ̀dọ́mọdé eléré-ìje.

translation.en: Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.
translation.yo: Wíwà ní ìlera àti okun tí ó pé, mímú omi bí oh ti tọ́ àti níní òye àwọn ohun tí ẹniyàn lè máa jẹ tí yóò fún ni ní ìlera kíkún lè ran àwọn tí wọn máa n ṣe eré ìdárayá lọ́wọ́ láti gbádun ìdárayá, kí wọ́n sì ṣe dáadáa nínú rẹ̀.

translation.en: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate.
translation.yo: Ìsáré ní ààrín méjí jé eré ìdárayá tí kò wọ́n jú, síbẹ́ àwọn èrò tí kò jẹ òótọ́ tó jẹma àwọn irinṣẹ́ díẹ̀ tí o nílò láti kópa.

translation.en: Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance.
translation.yo: A lè ra ohun èlò nígbàkúgbà tí lílò bá kàn án, àmọ́ ọ̀pọ̀ ní kò ní ní ipa púpò tàbí kankan lóri ìsé.

translation.en: Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.
translation.yo: Awon elere idaraya le ro pe won feran oja kan pelu pe ko fun wa ni anfani gidi kan kan.

translation.en: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter.
translation.yo: Átọ́mù jẹ ǹkan tó ṣe pàtàkì láti kọ lé.

translation.en: Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1.
translation.yo: Ó jẹ́ ǹkan tó ṣẹlẹgẹ́ tó ní, gẹ́gẹ́ bí àwòṣe Bohr, ti nucleus àárín orbited by electrons, tó jọ planet orbiting the sun wo Figure 1.1.

translation.en: The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons.
translation.yo: Èròjà méjì ní ó wà ninú ìwọ́jọsí - àwọn náà ni neutrons àti protons.

translation.en: Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.
translation.yo: Protons ní agbára iná nígbàtí neutron kò ní agbára rárá. Awon electrons ni aagbara ina olodi.

translation.en: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety.
translation.yo: Láti sàyẹ̀wò afarakáásá, o gbọ́dọ̀ kọ́kọ́ se àyèwò ibi ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ fún ààbò ara rẹ.

translation.en: You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags.
translation.yo: O ni láti ṣe àwòfin ipò tí ẹni tó fi ara pa wà bí o ṣe ń sún mọ́ ọ.

translation.en: If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.
translation.yo: Ti o ba farapa nigbati o n ṣe iranlọwọ, awọn nkan le bajẹ sii.

translation.en: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers.
translation.yo: Iṣẹ́ ìwádìí náà fìdí rẹ̀ múlẹ̀ pé ìbànújẹ́, ẹ̀rù àti àjálù má a ń ṣokùnfà ìrora àti àìlera fún àwọn tó má a ń ní ìrora ní ìsàlẹ̀ ẹ̀hìn.

translation.en: Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions.
translation.yo: Awọn ipa ti ajalu nikan, kiise ibanujẹ tabi ẹru ni o jẹ awọn isẹlẹ gbẹdẹkẹ ọlọsọọsẹ ti akoko PA.
