translation.en: Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.
translation.yo: Àwọn tó n ṣe ìṣe dédé wọn nílò ìgbèlẹ́yìn sí nípasẹ̀ ojú burúkú tí a fi n rí ẹ̀dùn sí, láti tọ́ka sí ìyàtọ̀ láàrín ẹ̀dùn ti o jẹ́ àìsàn àti ẹ̀dùn tí o wáyé torípé a gbọn ara.

translation.en: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes.
translation.yo: Ìran tàbí okun láti ríran dá lórí ẹ̀yà ìríran .

translation.en: There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism.
translation.yo: Orisirisi ona ni a n gba da oju, eyi ti o pe orisirisi lori bi awon ohun ti kokoro aifojuri se lagbara to.

translation.en: The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.
translation.yo: Àwọn oríṣiríṣi ìkọ́lé náà ni onírúru agbára, wọn si ní ìmòlára sí onírurú ìgbì áti wípé wọn ní yíyàtọ̀ ìwọ̀n sí mímu, pèlu pé wọn nílò onírúurú ìlànà láti mu ìtumò jádẹ lára ìgbéwọlẹ́ áti oríṣiríṣi nọ́mbà láti sisẹ́ dáradára.

translation.en: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area.
translation.yo: Iye olùgbé ni ákójọ àwọn ohun ẹlẹ́yà kan láàrin agbègbè .

translation.en: When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic.
translation.yo: Nígbàtí àwọn èèyàn tó wà níbùgbé bá ní ìdánimọ̀ to ní í se pẹ̀lú ìjọra jíìnì, wọ́n má ń pèwọ́n ní oníjọra.

translation.en: When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.
translation.yo: Ti eyan kan ba fi opolopo orisi iwa kan han a je pe won wa polimofiki.

translation.en: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well.
translation.yo: Àwọn ikọ̀ ológun àwọn kòkòrò ma ń tó lọ́wọ̀ọ̀wọ́ sinmi nípele nípele pẹ̀lú.

translation.en: In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day.
translation.yo: Ní àyè àtijọ́, àwọn ọmọ ogun ìjàlọ rìn ní alé wọ́n sí ma dúró láti sùn ní ojú mọmọ.

translation.en: The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday.
translation.yo: Ìletò náà bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìgbéayé má a kó kiri látibìkan sí ibòmíràn ńgbàti àdínkù bá oúnjẹ tó wà nílẹ̀, ìletò náà se ìtẹ́ ẹyẹ fúngbà kanná, èyí tí wọ́n má ń pààrọ̀ lójoójúmọ́.

translation.en: Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.
translation.yo: Òkànkan àwọn wíwu ìwà ipá àti ìfẹ̀hónúhàn àwọn alárànká yìí yìó wáyé fún bi ọjọ́ métàdínlógún.

translation.en: What is a cell? The word cell comes from the Latin word "cella", meaning "small room", and it was first coined by a microscopist observing the structure of cork.
translation.yo: Kínni sẹ́ẹ̀lì? ọ̀rọ̀ náà wá látinú ọ̀rọ̀ Latin tí wọ́n pè ní “cella”, ìtumọ̀ “iyàrá kékerá” tí wọ́n sì mún un jáde látinu àyẹ̀wò àwọn kòkòrò kékeré àti ètò ìdẹ́nu.

translation.en: The cell is the basic unit of all living things, and all organisms are composed of one or more cells.
translation.yo: Sẹ́ẹ̀lì jẹ́ ǹkan pàtàkì ní ara gbogbo ǹkan tó ń mí, àti pé gbogbo organism lóní sẹ́ẹ̀lì kan tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ ní ara wọn.

translation.en: Cells are so basic and critical to the study of life, in fact, that they are often referred to as "the building blocks of life".
translation.yo: Sẹ́ẹ̀lì jẹ́ nǹkan pàtàkì láti mọ̀ nípa ẹ̀kọ́ ayé, kódà wọn a máa pè wọn ni “amọ̀ tí a fi ń mọ ilẹ ayé wa”.

translation.en: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed.
translation.yo: Ohun tí ó ń mójútó bí àwọn iṣan ara se n siṣẹ́ nígbogbo ìgbà láti ri wípé ohun gbogbo ń lọ déédé nípa fifi ìró ránṣẹ́ sí gbogbo ẹ̀yà ara làti ri wípé ẹ̀jẹ̀ ń lọ káakkiri bí ó ti yẹ láìní ìdíwọ́ kankan.

translation.en: These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.
translation.yo: Awon irora isan wonyi le lo kaakiri ara ti o ma n daabo bo ara lati owo ihale kankan to le waye.

translation.en: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path.
translation.yo: Èfúùfù líle kọlu àwọn agbègbè kékeré yàtọ̀ sí àwọn ìjì líle mìíràn, sùgbọ́n wọ́n lè ba gbogbo nǹkan tó wà lójú ọ̀nà wọn jẹ́.

translation.en: Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours.
translation.yo: Ẹ̀fúùfù ńlá máa ń wú igi ti gbòǹgbò ti gbòǹgbò, a máá sí páànù ilé, a sì máa gbé ọkọ̀ lọ lójú òfurufú. Ìdá méjì ìjì a máa lò tayọ wákàtí mẹ́ta gbáko.

translation.en: These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
translation.yo: Ìjì líle ti gbì tó okòódínníẹ̀dẹ́gbẹ̀ta kìlómítà láàrin wákàtí (133 m/s; 300 mph).

translation.en: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years.
translation.yo: Awon eyan ti n se lo lensi won de ti n fi fe iran fun egbegberun odun.

translation.en: However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century.
translation.yo: Sibesibe, ero awoye akoko ni a se ni ilu awon alawo funfun ni opin 16th century.

translation.en: These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.
translation.yo: Awon ero iwoye yi n lo apapo lensi meji ti o n mu ki ohun ti o jina dabi ohun ti o sun mo ni, ti o si tobi.

translation.en: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly
translation.yo: Ìmọ taraẹni àti ìjẹkújẹ ma wà nínu wa ó sí jẹ́ nínu ìfọwasowọ́pọ̀ ní nígbàtí ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn bá jẹ́ àǹfàní ni a ma ṣe rí èrè ní ọjọ́ tí kò pẹ́

translation.en: Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.
translation.yo: A n retí pé ọ̀pọ̀ èyàn ló ma ríi pé iṣẹ́ àparapọ̀ ṣe pẹ̀lú àwọn èyàn ló sàn jù fún ìgbà gígùn.

translation.en: Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant.
translation.yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ èyàn ló n lálàá ọjọ́ tí ọmọ èyàn á rin ìrìn àjò lọ sínú ìràwọ̀ mín tí wọn á káàkiri agbaye mín, àwọn èyàn mín ń ro nkan tí ó wà ní agbaye mín àwọn kan gbàgbọ́ pé àwọn àjòjì mín wà, tàbí pé alàyè wà ní àwọn agbọn mín.

translation.en: But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are "neighbors".
translation.yo: Sùgbón, tí èyí ba´ sèlè rárá èyí ti kò dájú láti sẹlè ní ọjọ́ iwájú. Àwọn ìràwọ̀ náà fọn kàkiri tó bẹ gẹ wípé àwọn àìmoyẹ ìbùsọ̀ láárin àwọn ìràwọ̀ wònyí tí sẹ “aládùúgbò”.

translation.en: Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?
translation.yo: Bóyá ní ọjọ́ kan, àwọn ọmọ ọmọ ọmọ rẹ yí ò ma dúró lórí ilẹ̀ àjèjì máa wòye nípa àwọn baba àtijọ wọn?

translation.en: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move.
translation.yo: Àpapọ̀ seeli púpọ̀ la fí dá ẹlẹ́ran ara. Wọ́n ma n jẹun wọn dẹ̀ ma n fọ́ọsí wẹ́wẹ́ nínú wọn. Púpọ̀ nínú ẹlẹ́ran ara ló lè rìn.

translation.en: Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains).
translation.yo: Awon eranko nikan ni o ni opolo (bo tile je wipe kiise gbogbo eranko ni o ni opolo; fun apere eja jelly, ko ni opolo).

translation.en: Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.
translation.yo: Eranko wà káàkiri Gbogbo àgbáyé. Wọn a ma gbẹ́lẹ̀, wọ́n a má lúwẹ̀ẹ́ ọ̀sà, wọ́n a ma fò lójú ọ̀run.

translation.en: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism.
translation.yo: Seeli je eya ara (awon) alaye to kere ju to ni itosona ati ise.

translation.en: Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room.
translation.yo: Seeli wa lati oro Latiini cella to tumo si iyara kekere.

translation.en: If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls.
translation.yo: Tí ẹ bá wo àwọn nǹkan ẹlẹ́mìí nínú ẹ̀rọ-awòjìji-amóhun-bín-tín-fẹ̀, a máa rí pé láti ara nnkan onígun tàbí nǹkan roboto ni a ti ṣẹ̀dá wọ.

translation.en: Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope.
translation.yo: Robaati Hooki, Olùmọ̀ bayọ́lọ́jì láti ìlú Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, ri skwia kekeke ninu kooki pẹ̀lú ẹ̀rọ mikroskopi.

translation.en: They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells
translation.yo: Wọn jọ iyàrá. Òun ní ẹni àkọ́kọ́ tí ó kọ́ sèwòye òòkú sẹ́ẹ̀lì.

translation.en: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change.
translation.yo: Àwọn elimenti ati compandi lè pàrọ̀ ara láti dídáwà kan sí òmíràn láì yípadà.

translation.en: Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same.
translation.yo: Nitrogen gẹ́gẹ́ bí gáàsì ṣì ní ohun èlò bí i nitrogen olómi. ipò omi ti dìpọ̀ ṣùgbọ́n molecule náà kò yàtọ.

translation.en: Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom.
translation.yo: Omi jẹ́ àpẹrẹ mìíràn. omi compound water ni wọ́n fi hydrogen atom méjì àti oxgen atom kan se.

translation.en: It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid.
translation.yo: O ní àgbẹkalẹ̀ mólíkuúlà kan náà yálà o jẹ aféfé gaasi, olómi, tàbí ní lìlẹ.

translation.en: Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.
translation.yo: Ṣùgbọ́n ipò tó wà lè yípadà, ipò kẹ́míkà rè lè wà bó ṣe wà.

translation.en: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand.
translation.yo: Àkókò loun tí ó yíwa káàkiri, tí ó sì má ń nípa lórí ohun gbogbo tí a bá ṣe, à mọ́ ó ṣòro láti mọ̀.

translation.en: Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years.
translation.yo: Àwọn ẹlẹ́sìn, oní fìlọ́sọ́fà àtàwọn ọnímọ̀ sáyẹ̀nsìti ń se ìwáàdí àkókò fún ẹgbẹ̀lẹ́gbẹ̀ ọdún.

translation.en: We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past.
translation.yo: A ní ìrírí àkókò gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tó ń ṣẹ̀ lẹ́sẹsẹ láti ọjọ́ iwájú wá sí àkókò yìí lọ sẹ́yìn.

translation.en: Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events.
translation.yo: Àkókò tún jẹ́ bi a se ń ṣe àfiwẹ́ iye àkókò (gígùn) àwọn ìsẹ̀lẹ̀.

translation.en: You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.
translation.yo: O le ka bi igba se n lo fun ara re ko maa wo bi isele ayipo se tun sele. Isele ayipo je nkan to ma n saba sele leemewa si.

translation.en: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos.
translation.yo: Lóde òní wọ́n máa ń lo Kòǹpútà láti sàtúnrọ àwòrán àti fọ́ńrán.

translation.en: Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films.
translation.yo: A le lo ẹ̀rọ ayárabíàṣá láti ya àwọn Awòrán ìgbàlódé tó jẹ ojú ni gbèsè, àwọn irúfẹ́ àwòrán wọ̀nyí ni wọ́n ń lo ní orí amóhùnmáwòrán àti ní inú àgbéléwò báyìí.

translation.en: Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.
translation.yo: A má n sába gba orin sílẹ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn ẹ̀rọ ayára bí àṣá gíga ti a fi n lò láti ṣètò àti po àwọn ìró ohùn pọ̀.

translation.en: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas.
translation.yo: Fún ọjọ́ pípẹ́ lákòókò sẹ́ńtúrì kọkàndínlógún àti ogún, wọ́n gbàgbọ́ wípé àwọn tó kọ́kọ́ gbé ní New Zealand làwọn èèyàn Maori, tí wọ́n má ń dọdẹ ẹyẹ ńlá tí wọ́n pè ní moas.

translation.en: The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society.
translation.yo: Àlàyé náà wá fìdí àbá náà múlẹ̀ pé àwọn ènìyàn Maori kúrò láti Polynesia pẹ̀lú ọkọ̀ tó dára wọ́n sì lọ sí New Zealand láti Maori tí wọ́n sì dá ẹgbẹ́ ǹkan ọ̀gbìn sílẹ̀.

translation.en: However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture.
translation.yo: Àmọ́ṣá, ẹ̀rí tuntun sàfihàn pé àwọn Moriori jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn Maori tí wọ́n kó kúrò ní New Zealand lọ sí erékùsù Chatham, se àgbéga àṣà ti wọn tó yàtọ̀ találàfíà.

translation.en: There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand.
translation.yo: Èyà míràn tún wà ní ẹrékùsù Chatham àwon ara´ Maori tí won sèwá láti New Zealand.

translation.en: They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out
translation.yo: Wọn pẹ ara wọn ní àwọn ónilé ẹrẹ́kúsú Polynesia àwọn àkùdẹ́ díè bàwọn ní ìgbẹ̀yìn, àwọn ónilé ẹrẹ́kúsú Polynesia di píparẹ́.

translation.en: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures.
translation.yo: Àwọn ẹnìyàn tí wọ́n wà nínu rl fún ọdún pípẹ́ gbóríyìn fún agbára àti ìfẹ́ wa nígbà tí wọ́n ṣàyẹ̀wó àìṣedédé wa àti ìjákulẹ̀ w.

translation.en: While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization.
translation.yo: Nígbà tá à ń gbọ́ bí oníkálukú se ń sọ ìtàn oníkóówá, mọ̀lẹ́bí, àti ẹgbẹ́jẹgbẹ́, a rí ìwòye tó péye sí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tó ti sẹ̀ sẹ́yín àti àwọn èèyàn tó ti se rere tàbí ìbàjẹ́ sí àṣà ẹgbẹ́.

translation.en: While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization.
translation.yo: Bí èyàn bá mọ ìtàn àbáláyé ẹni kò túmọ̀ si wípe o mọ àṣà náà, ṣùgbọ́n ó ṣáà ma n jẹ́ kí ibi tí èyàn wà bọ́ sí ètò ilé iṣé náà yé wọn.

translation.en: While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization.
translation.yo: Nigba ti aba n se ayewo aseyori, ti a si n se akiesi awon ijakule, onikaluku ati gbogbo awon to kopa se akiyesi ti o jinle lori isepataki si, awon ohun ti o se koko ati opakutele ti ajo naa.

translation.en: In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church.
translation.yo: Fún àpẹẹrẹ yìí, sise ìrántí àwọn ìhùwàsí onísòwò àti àwọn àbájáde àsẹyorí rẹ máà n ran àwọn ènìyàn lọ́wọ́ làti tẹ́wọ́gba àwọn ìyàtọ titun àti ìdarí fún ìjọ agbẹ̀gbẹ̀.

translation.en: Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.
translation.yo: Àwọn ìtàn àseyọrí mún àdínkù bá ìbẹ̀rù àyípadà, níbí ó se ń sàfilọ́lẹ̀ ìfọkànsìn rere fún àyípadapà ọjọ́ iwájú.

translation.en: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution.
translation.yo: Ona ijiroro lorisirisi ti isowopo je ara ona ti an gba wa ojutu si awon isoro ti o so orisi imo ati iyapa papo.

translation.en: The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information.
translation.yo: Afojusun ero okan yi ni ijafafa, ogbon inu ati isefefe o tun je ida otito mo, lilo awon eeto aatele ti o wa nile, kiko otito jo.

translation.en: The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong.
translation.yo: Ohun tí ó se pàtàkì jù nínú èrò yìí ni : ìdáhùn ẹyọ̀kan ṣoṣo ni ó tọ̀na. Ìsáhùn méjì péré ni yíò wá sọ́kàn rẹ, èyí náà ni, èyí tó tọ̀nà tàbí èyí tí kò tọ̀nà.

translation.en: This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures.
translation.yo: Iru ironu yii ni nkan se pelu imo ijinle abi gbedeke ilana to wa.

translation.en: People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.
translation.yo: Àwọn ènìyàn tó ní irú ìrònú yìí ní ọpọlọ, wọ́n sì lè gbé ǹkan sórí, wọ́n lè yànjú ìṣòro wọ́n sì lè ṣiṣẹ́ lórí ìdánwò síẹ́nsì.

translation.en: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others.
translation.yo: Àwọn ọmọ ènìyàn ni wọ́n ni ẹ̀bùn kí wọ́n máa wòye ohun tó ń lọ ni ọkan ẹlòmìíràn.

translation.en: That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire.
translation.yo: Eyi tumọ si wipe a ṣe aṣeyọri lori sisọ asọtẹlẹ lori ohun ti awọn eniyan n ro, pinnu, gbagbọ, mọ tabi gba lero.

translation.en: Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions.
translation.yo: Nínú gbogbo àwọn okun wọ̀nyí, mímọ èròngbà àwọn ẹlòmíràn ṣe kókó. O maa ń fàyè gbà wá láti yanjú ìṣòro tó séeṣée kó jẹyọ láti ara ìbàkégbépọ ara wa.

translation.en: For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car.
translation.yo: Fun apeere, ti o ba ri enikan to n fo gilaasi oko, iwo o rope o fe ji oko oloko ni.

translation.en: He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.
translation.yo: Ọkùnrin náà yíò nílò láti gba ìdájọ́ ní àràọ̀tọ̀ tó bá jẹ́ wípé ó pàdánù kọ́kọ́rọ́ ọkọ̀ rẹ̀ tó sì jẹ́ wípé ọkọ̀ rẹ̀ ló ń gbìyànjú àti já wọ̀.

translation.en: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University).
translation.yo: MRI dálórí kàyéfì fisiksi ta n pè ní nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), tí Felisi Boṣi (tó n ṣiṣẹ́ ní Ile Iwe Giga Stanfodi) àti Edwodi Pọseli (láti Ile Iwe Giga Hafadi) wárí ní 1930s.

translation.en: In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals.
translation.yo: Nínú àbájáde yìí, àwọn pápá agbérin àti ìgbì rádíò tó ń fa átọ̀mù tó fún àwọn rádìò kéèkèé ní àfihàn.

translation.en: In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis.
translation.yo: Ní ọdún 1970, dókítà oníṣègùn òyìnbó àti ìwádìí ìmò sáyẹ́nsì, Raymond Damadian, ṣàwárí lílo ohun òǹfà ìgbohún-pẹ̀lú -àwòrán jáde gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹ̀rọ fún àyẹ̀wò àwọn ìwádìí àìsàn.

translation.en: Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI.
translation.yo: Lẹ́yìn ọdún mẹ́rin wọ́n fàṣe sí ẹ̀tọ́ náà, ó jẹ́ ẹ̀tọ́ àkọ́kọ́ tí wọ́n ma fàṣę sí nínú ẹ̀kọ MRI.

translation.en: In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.
translation.yo: Ni 1977, Dokita Damadiani pari kiko skana MRI “ti gbogbo ara” to pe ni “Ailesegun”.

translation.en: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others.
translation.yo: Ijiroro ti ko waye ni akoko kanna ma n fi aye sile fun arojinle ati ifura si.

translation.en: It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information.
translation.yo: Ó fún àwọn akẹ́ẹ̀kọ́ ní agbára àt siṣẹ́ pẹ̀lú ipa wọn àti bí wọ́n se lè kápá àlàyé ìròyìn wọn.

translation.en: In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998)
translation.yo: Ní afikún, àwọn ìfòfindè àkóókò pẹ̀lú àfojúsùn àti múndẹ̀rùn akókò isẹ́ wáyé. (Bremer, 1998)

translation.en: The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times.
translation.yo: Lilo ẹrọ ayelujara ati itakun-agbaye fun awọn akẹkọ maa jẹki wọn ni anfani si alaye ni gbogbo igba.

translation.en: Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.
translation.yo: Àwọn akẹ́ẹ̀kọ́ lè fi ìbéèrè wọn ṣọwọ́ sáwọn olùdarí nígbàkúgbà kí wọ́n sì retí èsì kíákiá, ju kí wọ́n má a dúró de àkókò ípàdé ojú ko ojú tó ń bọ̀.

translation.en: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn.
translation.yo: Ìgbẹ́sẹ̀ igbeyin ìgbàlódẹ́ lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ sí ẹ̀kọ́ kíkọ́ sètò òmìnira kúrò lọ́wọ́ àwọn Ìgbẹ́sẹ̀ áìlatúnsẹ. Kò sí ọ̀nà kan sọsọ tò dára jùlo fún ẹ̀kọ́ kíkọ.

translation.en: In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented.
translation.yo: Kódà, kò sí ohunkóhun tí ó dára láti kọ́. ìkọ́ni máa ń wáyé nínú ìrírí láàrín akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ àti ìmọ̀ tí a gbé kalẹ̀.

translation.en: Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point.
translation.yo: Ìrírí wa lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ pélù sísẹsé fúnraeni àti fífi àlàyé síta, àwọn àfihàn amóhùnmáwòrán fún ìkẹ́ẹ́kọ́ sàpèjúwẹ ìtọ́kasí yìí.

translation.en: So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge.
translation.yo: Opolopo ninu wa ni a ba ara wa ti a n wo ere ori amohunmaworan to sàfihàn iriri tabi isesi ti a o le kopa ninu tabi ya imo re lo lai lai.

translation.en: We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.
translation.yo: A o ni ti moto pale lai lai, ko orisun omi si eyinkule wa, rin lo Peru lati lo wo erunrun atijo, abi tun ile aladugbo wa ko.

translation.en: Thanks to undersea fiber optic cable links to Europe and broadband satellite, Greenland is well connected with 93% of the population having internet access.
translation.yo: Ọpẹlopé àsopọ̀ okùn fibre lábẹ́ òkun tsi Yuropi ati boolu gbohungbohun satelaiti, Greenland ní àsopọ̀ dada pẹ̀lú 93% àwọn èrò tó ráyè lo íńtánẹ̀ẹ̀tì.

translation.en: Your hotel or hosts (if staying in a guesthouse or private home) will likely have wifi or an internet connected PC, and all settlements have an internet cafe or some location with public wifi.
translation.yo: Agbàlejò tàbí ilé ìtura rẹ (tí o bá ń wà ní ilé ìgbàlejò tàbí ilé ẹnìkan) lè ní wifi tàbí íntánẹ́ẹ̀tì tí wọ́n sopọ̀ mọ́ ẹ̀rọ kọ́mpútà, àti pé gbogbo ilé ìgbàlejò lóní ìyàrá íntánẹ́ẹ̀tì tàbí ibi tóní wifi fún gbogbogbò.

translation.en: As mentioned above, though the word "Eskimo" remains acceptable in the United States, it is considered pejorative by many non-U.S. Arctic peoples, especially in Canada.
translation.yo: Bi a se daruko loke, biotilejepe ni ilu Amerika won gba ilo “Eskimo”, o si je eebu leti awon ti o ki n se ara Amerika - awon ara Atiki paa pa julo ni Kanada.

translation.en: While you may hear the word used by Greenlandic Natives, its use should be avoided by foreigners.
translation.yo: O lè ma gbọ́ pé áwọn ará Grinlandikí se n ló oro náà, o yẹ kí àwọn àjèjì má a sọ́ra fún un.

translation.en: The native inhabitants of Greenland call themselves Inuit in Canada and Kalaalleq (plural Kalaallit), a Greenlander, in Greenland.
translation.yo: Àwọn ará ìlú Greenland ma ń pera wọ́n ní Inuit ní Canada àti Kalaalleq (ọ̀pọ̀ Kalaallit Greenlander ní Greenland.

translation.en: Crime, and ill-will toward foreigners in general, is virtually unknown in Greenland. Even in the towns, there are no "rough areas."
translation.yo: ọ̀ràn, àti èrò ibi sí àlejò, jẹ ohun tí wọn kò mọ̀ ni Greenland. Kódà ní ìlú náàm kò sí “agbègbè tó rí jákujàk.”

translation.en: Cold weather is perhaps the only real danger the unprepared will face.
translation.yo: Ojú ọjọ́ to tutù sẹésẹ́ ko jé ẹwu kan sọsọ tí aláìmúrasílè ma dojú kọ.

translation.en: If you visit Greenland during cold seasons (considering that the further north you go, the colder it will be), it is essential to bring warm enough clothing.
translation.yo: To ba bẹ Grinlandi wo ni igba otutu (bi o ṣe n sumọ apa ariwa, o n tutu si i) o ṣe dandan fun ẹ lati mu aṣọ otutu to peye wa.

translation.en: The very long days in the summer can lead to problems getting sufficient sleep and associated health issues.
translation.yo: Awon ojo to gun ju ni igba ooru le muu ki o soro lati ri orun to peye sun ati awon ailera bee.

translation.en: During the summer, also watch out for the Nordic mosquitoes. Although they do not transmit any diseases, they can be irritating.
translation.yo: Ní àsìkò ooru, fojúsílẹ̀ pẹ̀lú fún àwọn ẹ̀fọn alárìnká. Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé wọ́n kì ń tan àrùn ká, wọ́n a má a rìnyànláyà.

translation.en: While San Francisco's economy is linked to it being a world-class tourist attraction, its economy is diversified.
translation.yo: Níwọn ìgbà tí aje San Francisco sopọ mọ bó ṣe jẹ́ ibi ti gbogbo arìnrìnajo àgbáyẹ nífẹsí, ajẹ́ rẹ jẹ́ oníruurú.

translation.en: The largest employment sectors are professional services, government, finance, trade, and tourism.
translation.yo: Àwọn ẹka tó ń gbanisíṣẹ́ jùlọ ní àwọn akọ́ṣẹ́-mọṣẹ́, ìjọba, ìnáwó, ìsòwò àti ìrìn àjò afẹ́.

translation.en: Its frequent portrayal in music, films, literature and popular culture has helped make the city and its landmarks known throughout the world.
translation.yo: Ìfihàn àwòrán rẹ lóorèkòorẹ́ nínú orin, ẹrẹ́, lítírẹ́sọ̀ àti àsa olókìkí ti ran Ìlu náà áti sọ ámí rẹ di mímọ̀ ní gbogbo àgbáyẹ́.

translation.en: San Francisco has developed a large tourist infrastructure with numerous hotels, restaurants, and top-notch convention facilities.
translation.yo: San Francisco ti ka ilé ńlá fún àwọn tó rìnrìn àjò wá sí ìlú yẹn pẹ̀lú ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ilé ìtura, ilé óúnjé, àti ibi tí wọ́n ti lè ṣe ìpàdé.

translation.en: San Francisco is also one of the best places in the nation for other Asian cuisine: Korean, Thai, Indian, and Japanese.
translation.yo: San Francisco jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn ibi tó dára jù ní orílẹ̀èdè fún oúnjẹ ilẹ Asia; Korean, Thai, Indian, àti Japan.

translation.en: Traveling to Walt Disney World represents a major pilgrimage for many American families.
translation.yo: Ìrìn àjò lọ sí Walt Disney World, dúró gẹ́gẹ́ ìrìnàjò pàtàkì fún àwọn ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ẹbí ní ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà.

translation.en: The "typical" visit involves flying into Orlando International Airport, busing to an on-site Disney hotel, spending about a week without leaving Disney property, and returning home.
translation.yo: Lọ́pọ̀ igba, àbẹ̀wò náà màa ń pẹ fún rìnrìn-àjò òfuurufú sí pápákọ̀ òfuurufú àgbáyé ti Orlando, wíwọ ọkọ̀ akérò sí ilé ìtura Disney, lílọ bi ọ́sẹ́ kan láìkúrò lórí ́àwọǹ ohun-ìní Disney, àti pípadà sílẹ́.

translation.en: There are infinite variations possible, but this remains what most people mean when they talk of "going to Disney World".
translation.yo: Orírìíríṣìí ìdí ni ó wà tí o lè fà á, ṣùgbọ́n èyí jẹ́ ohun tí ọ̀pọ̀ ní lọ́kàn tí wọ́n ba ń sọ̀rọ̀ nípa “lílọ sí Disney World”.

translation.en: Many tickets sold online through auction websites such as eBay or Craigslist are partially used multi-day park-hopper tickets.
translation.yo: Awọn tikẹẹti ti wọn ta lori oju iwe ayelujara ti wọn ti n se basa bii eBay abi Craiglist, ma n jẹ aloku tikẹẹti ọlọjọ-pupọ fokiri-fokiri.

translation.en: While this is a very common activity, it is prohibited by Disney: the tickets are non-transferable.
translation.yo: Biotilejepe ise yi maa n saba waye, Awon Disney lodi si; tíkẹ̀tì ò sí se é gbé fúni.

translation.en: Any camping below the rim in Grand Canyon requires a backcountry permit.
translation.yo: Ipàgọ́ lábẹ́ etí Canyon ńlá nílò ìwé àṣę ilú ẹ̀yìn.

translation.en: Permits are limited to protect the canyon, and become available on the 1st day of the month, four months prior to the start month.
translation.yo: Gbígbani láàyè ní gbèǹdéke láti dáàbòbò ọ̀gbun ńlá àti láti jẹ́ kó wà ní ọjọ́ àkọ́kọ́ inú oṣù, oṣù mẹ́rin sí ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ oṣù.

translation.en: Thus, a backcountry permit for any start date in May becomes available on 1 Jan.
translation.yo: Torinaa iwease fun odiilu to bere ni Osu Ebibi ma w anile lati Sere .

translation.en: Space for the most popular areas, such as the Bright Angel Campground adjacent to Phantom Ranch, generally fill up by the requests received on first date they are opened to reservations.
translation.yo: Àyè fún àwọn agbègbè olókìkí, bi ilè àgọ Brighy Angel ní ìkángun sí oko ẹran ọ̀sìn Phantom, lọ́pọ̀ ìgbà màa ń jẹ́ gbígbà tan nípa ìpè làti yọ̀nda tí o di gbígbà ní Ọjọ́ àkọ́kọ́ wọn si fàyẹ̀ gba mímú àyè sílẹ̀ síwáájú.

translation.en: There are a limited number permits reserved for walk-in requests available on a first come, first served basis.
translation.yo: Wọn tí fi díè nínún áwọn ìwé àse pamó fún àwọn tó ba rìn wá sẹ bẹ̀rẹ̀r; o wà nílè fún ẹnikéni tó bá kọ́kọ́ wá.

translation.en: Entering Southern Africa by car is an amazing way to see all the region's beauty as well as to get to places off the normal tourist routes.
translation.yo: Wíwọ orílẹ̀èdè South Africa pẹ̀lú ọkọ̀ jẹ́ ọ̀nà ìyanu láti rí àwọn ẹwà ẹkùn náà àti láti dé àwọn ibi táwan arìnrìnajó kò lè dé.

translation.en: This can be done in a normal car with careful planning but a 4x4 is highly advised and many locations are only accessible with a high wheel base 4x4.
translation.yo: A le se eyi ni oko ayokele pelu eto sugbon 4x4 ni won saba gba ni amoran pelu pe a ko le de awon ibo miin lai lo 4x4 ti ese re ga soke daada.

translation.en: Keep in mind while planning that although Southern Africa is stable not all neighboring countries are.
translation.yo: Fi bí o ṣe ń ṣètò sọ́kàn pé biotilejepe gúúsù Ilẹ̀ Afirika rọgbọ kìí ṣe gbogbo ìlú tó yíiká ló rí bẹ́ẹ̀.

translation.en: Visa requirements and costs vary from nation to nation and are affected by the country you come from.
translation.yo: Owó àti ohun èlò iwé físà ma n yàtọ̀ láti ìlú kan sí òmíràn ìlú tí o ti wa naa ma nípa nínú ẹ̀.

translation.en: Each country also has unique laws requiring what emergency items need to be in the car.
translation.yo: Orílẹ̀èdè kọ̀ọ̀kan ní àwọn òfin tó dá ń tọ́ tó ń bèèrè fáwọn ohun èlò pàjáwìrì tó yẹ kí ó wà nínú ọkọ̀.

translation.en: Victoria Falls is a town in the western portion of Zimbabwe, across the border from Livingstone, Zambia, and near Botswana.
translation.yo: Victoria Falls je ilu ni agbegbe iwo oorun Zimbabwe eyi ti o la enu ibode lati Livingstone, Zambia koja eyi ti o sunmo Botswana.

translation.en: The town lies immediately next to the falls, and they are the major attraction, but this popular tourist destination offers both adventure seekers and sightseers plenty of opportunities for a longer stay.
translation.yo: Ìlú náà tẹ̀dó ní kété sí àwọn ìdàwálẹ̀ omi, àti wípẹ́ wọn jẹ ibi ìfamọ́ra pàtàkì, sùgbón ibi ìdúrósí olókìkí fún àwọn arìnrìnàjó yìí pẹ̀sẹ̀ ànfàní lọ́pọ̀lọpọ̀ fùn àwọn arìnrìnàjó ìgbafẹ́ àti ẹ̀rò ìwòran dúró pípẹ́.

translation.en: In the rainy season (November to March), the water volume will be higher and the Falls will be more dramatic.
translation.yo: Ní àsìkò òjò, (oṣù kọkànlá sí oṣù kẹta), ìwọn omi yíó pọ̀ sí tí ìjáwásílẹ̀ yíò sí dàbí àrà.

translation.en: You are guaranteed to get wet if you cross the bridge or walk along the trails winding near the Falls.
translation.yo: Mo fi dá ọ lójú pé tí o bá fi lè sọdá afárá náà tàbí rìn lẹba ọ̀nà lásìkọ òjò, gbogbo ara rẹ lo máa tutù.

translation.en: On the other hand, it is precisely because the volume of water is so high that your viewing of the actual Falls will be obscured—by all the water!
translation.yo: Ní ìdàkejì, nítorí bí omi náà se pọ̀tọ́ ní yóò mun nira fún ọ láti rí bí omi se ń dà—pẹ̀lú gbogbo omi.

translation.en: Tomb of Tutankhamun (KV62). KV62 may be the most famous of the tombs in the Valley, the scene of Howard Carter's 1922 discovery of the almost intact royal burial of the young king.
translation.yo: Itẹ́ òkú Tutankhamun (KV62). KV62 lè jẹ́ itẹ́ tó gbajúmọ̀ jùlọ ní orí pẹ̀tẹ́lẹ̀, àwárí ìran Howard Carter's 192, tó jẹ́ ibi sàárè tó lọ́lá jùlọ fún ọba kékeré.

translation.en: Compared to most of the other royal tombs, however, the tomb of Tutankhamun is barely worth visiting, being much smaller and with limited decoration.
translation.yo: Ní síse àfiwé rẹ̀ sáwọn ibi ìtẹ́ òkú àwọn ọlọ́lá sí, àmọ́ṣà, ìtẹ́ òkú Tutankhamun kò yẹ ní ohun tí à ń sàbẹ̀wò sí, níbí ó se kére jù pẹ̀lú ìdálọ́lá tí kò pọ̀.

translation.en: Anyone interested in seeing evidence of the damage to the mummy done during attempts to remove it from the coffin will be disappointed as only the head and shoulders are visible.
translation.yo: Ẹni tí ó bá wù láti rí èrí ìpalára sí mummy ni ìgbà tí wọ́n ń gbìyànjú láti yọ ọ́ kúrò ní inú pósí, yóò banújẹ́, nítorí orí àti èjìká ni ó ṣe é rí.

translation.en: The fabulous riches of the tomb are no longer in it, but have been removed to the Egyptian Museum in Cairo.
translation.yo: Ọrọ̀ ńlá inú ibojì kò sí níbẹ̀ mọ́, sùgbọ́n wọ́n ti gbe lọ sí ilé ìkó iṣẹ́ ọnà sí ni Cairo, ní ilẹ̀ Egypt.

translation.en: Visitors with limited time would be best to spend their time elsewhere.
translation.yo: Ó ma dáa kí àwọn àlejò tí o ní àkókò púpọ̀ lògbà wọ́n níbò miin.

translation.en: Phnom Krom, 12 km southwest of Siem Reap. This hilltop temple was built at the end of the 9th century, during the reign of King Yasovarman.
translation.yo: Phnom Krom, kìlómítà méjìlà gúsù ìwọ ̀oòrun Siem Reap. Ibi Ìjọsìn tí wọ́n kọ́ sí òpin sẹńtúrì kẹsan, nígbàtí Ọba Yasovarman wà ní orí oy.

translation.en: The gloomy atmosphere of the temple and the view over the Tonle Sap lake make the climb to the hill worthwhile.
translation.yo: Wíwò bàìbàì ojú òfúrufú tẹ́m̀pìlì àti ìwòye láti orí odò adágún ti Tonle Sap jẹ́ kí òkè gígùn náà seyebíye.

translation.en: A visit to the site can be conveniently combined with a boat trip to the lake.
translation.yo: Àbẹ̀wò sí ààyè náà se é dàpọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìrìn-àjò ọkọ̀ ojú omi sí adágún láì sí ìnira.

translation.en: The Angkor Pass is needed to enter the temple so do not forget to bring your passport along when heading to Tonle Sap.
translation.yo: A nílò ìwé ìkọjá Angkoṛ láti wọnú ilé Ìsìn náà torínáà ma gbàgbé láti mú ìwé ìrìn àjò rę to bá n bọ̀ ní Tonle Sap.

translation.en: Jerusalem is the capital and largest city of Israel, though most other countries and the United Nations do not recognize it as Israel's capital.
translation.yo: Ilu Jesusalemu je iya ilu si ile Isreli ti o tobi julo,amo awon orileede to seku ati Ajo Agbaye ko ri bee.

translation.en: The ancient city in the Judean Hills has a fascinating history spanning thousands of years.
translation.yo: Ìlú ìgbàani tí ò wà ní Òke Juda ni ìtàn tó múnilọ́kàn tí ó sì ti ń gbòòrò láti bí ẹgbẹ̀rún ọdúnsẹ́yìn.

translation.en: The city is holy to the three monotheistic religions - Judaism, Christianity and Islam, and serves as a spiritual, religious, and cultural center.
translation.yo: Ilú náa jẹ́ mímọ́ nínú ẹ̀sìn mẹ́ta- Judaism,ọmọlẹ́yìn Kírísítì àti Ìsìláàmù, tí ó sì dúró gẹ́gẹ́ bí olú ìlú ẹ̀sìn, ìgbàgbọ́ àti àṣà.

translation.en: Due to the religious significance of the city, and in particular the many sites of the Old City area, Jerusalem is one of the main tourist destinations in Israel.
translation.yo: Látàrí bí ìlú náà se se pàtàkì fún ẹ̀sìn àti pàápàá jùlọ fáwọn agbègbè tó ti gbó níìlú, Jerusalem ló jẹ́ ibi ìrìnafẹ́ ní Isreal.

translation.en: Jerusalem has many historic, archeological and cultural sites, along with vibrant and crowded shopping centers, cafés, and restaurants.
translation.yo: ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìtàn, àṣà, ìṣe, ìwádìí ìjìnlẹ̀ ni ó rọ̀ mọ́ Jerúsálẹ́mù, bákan náà ni ọ̀pọ̀ ilé ìtajà elérò púpọ̀, ilé oúnjẹ àti ti ohun mímu ni ó wà níbẹ.

translation.en: Ecuador requires that Cuban citizens receive an invitation letter prior to entering Ecuador through international airports or frontier admission points.
translation.yo: Ecuador fẹ́ kí àwọn ará ìlú Cuban gba lẹ́tà ìpeni ṣáájú wíwọlé sí Ecuador ní ibùdókọ̀ ọkọ̀ òfurufú tàbí ibí ìgbaniwọlé.

translation.en: This letter must be legalized by the Ecuadorian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and comply with certain requirements.
translation.yo: Iléeṣẹ́ tó ń rí sọ́rọ̀ ilẹ̀ okèrè ilẹ̀ Ecuadorian, kí wọ́n sì tẹ̀lé àwọn àlàkalẹ̀ kọ̀ọ̀kan.

translation.en: These requirements are designed to provide an organized migratory flow between both countries.
translation.yo: Àwọn ohun tí a fẹ́ wọ̀nyí ni a gbé kalẹ̀ láti jẹ́ kí ìbáṣepọ̀ tí ó dá mọ́nrán wà láàárin orílẹ̀èdè méjèèj.

translation.en: Cuban citizens who are US green card holders should visit an Ecuadorian Consulate to obtain an exemption to this requirement.
translation.yo: Àwọn ọmọ orìlé-èdè Cuban tí wọ́n ní káàdì ìgbéèlú ní láti sàbẹ̀wò sí ọ́fíìsì asojú orìlé-èdè Ecuador láti gba ìyònda fún ètò ìmúlò yí.

translation.en: Your passport must be valid for at least 6 months beyond your travel dates. A round/onward trip ticket is needed to prove the length of your stay.
translation.yo: Ìwé ìrìnnà rẹ gbodò wà ní ìbámu o kéré tan osu mẹfa si àwọn ọjọ́ rínrin ìrin-àjò rẹ. Ìwé ìwọlé tọ péyẹ jẹ lílò làti sẹ èrí dídúró rẹ.

translation.en: Tours are cheaper for larger groups, so if you're by yourself or with just one friend, try to meet other people and form a group of four to six for a better per-person rate.
translation.yo: Ìrìn afẹ́ ò wọ́n fáwọn èrò tó bá pọ̀, torínà bí o bá ń dábọ̀ tàbí tí o bá wà pẹ̀lú ọ̀rọ́ rọ kanṣoṣo, gbìyànjú láti bá àwọn míìràn pàdé kí ẹ sì se àkójọ ẹgbẹ́ eléèyàn mẹ́rin sí mẹ́fà fúnrayín kí ẹ lè rí owó tó mọ níwọ̀n san léèyàn kọ̀ọ̀kan.

translation.en: However, this shouldn't really be off your concern, because often tourists are shuffled around to fill the cars.
translation.yo: Síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, èyí kò yẹ kó pò ọ́ lọ́fun pọ̀, nítorí ọ̀pọ̀ ìgbà ní wọ́n má ń da àwọn arìnrìn àjò afẹ́ papọ̀ sínú àwọn ọkọ̀.

translation.en: It seems actually to be more a way of tricking people into believing they have to pay more.
translation.yo: Ń se ló dàbí ọ̀nà ati má a tan àwọn ènìyàn jẹ́, kíwọ́n lè gbàgbọ́ wípé wọ́n nílò àti má a sanwó sí i.

translation.en: Towering above the north end of Machu Picchu is this steep mountain, often the backdrop to many photos of the ruins.
translation.yo: Èyí tó gàbá lé ẹkùn àríwá ẹ̀yìn Machu Picchu ni òkè yíyọ̀, ó tún jẹ́ ìtàkùn fáwọn àwòrán.

translation.en: It looks a bit daunting from below, and it is a steep and difficult ascent, but most reasonably fit persons should be able to make it in about 45 minutes.
translation.yo: Ó jọ bí ìgbà tó le láti abẹ́, ó sì lọ lẹ̀ ó tún le láti gun òkè, ṣùgbọ́n àwọn tí wọ́n ní okun àti agbára lè gùn ní àárín ìṣẹ́jú márùnlélógójì.

translation.en: Stone steps are laid along most of the path, and in the steeper sections steel cables provide a supporting handrail.
translation.yo: Wọn tó òkúta s’ẹ́gbẹ́ púpọ̀ ojú ọ̀nà náà àti pé níbi tó gajù okùn onírin pèsè réèlì ọwọ́ fún àtìlẹ́yìn.

translation.en: That said, expect to be out of breath, and take care in the steeper portions, especially when wet, as it can become dangerous quickly.
translation.yo: Wọ́n sọ pé, kí a ma retí mímí húlehúle, kí a sì tajú ara wá ní ibi tí ó bá lọsílẹ̀,pàápàá nígbàtí ilẹ̀ bá tuntun, nítorí ó lè ní ewu kíákíá.

translation.en: There's a tiny cave near the top that must be passed through, it is quite low and a rather tight squeeze.
translation.yo: Ihò kékeré kan wà ní ẹ̀gbẹ́ kan lókè tí a lè gbà kọjá, ó lọlẹ̀ ó sì fúnpa.

translation.en: Seeing the sites and wildlife of the Galapagos is best done by boat, just as Charles Darwin did it in 1835.
translation.yo: Fífi ọkọ̀ ojú omi wo ààyè àti awọn abẹ̀mí inú igbó Galapagos ló dára jùlọ, bí Charles Darwin se se ní ọdún 1835.

translation.en: Over 60 cruise ships ply the Galapagos waters - ranging in size from 8 to 100 passengers.
translation.yo: Àwọn ọkọ̀ orí omi tó ń rin odò Galapagos – wà láti ìwọ̀n elérò mẹ́jọ sí ọgọ́rùn-ún.

translation.en: Most people book their place well in advance (as the boats are usually full during the high season).
translation.yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn ló ma ń gbààyè sílẹ̀ saájú (torí ọkọ̀ ojú omi ti ma ń kún fọ́fọ́ láwọn àkókò tó ga).

translation.en: Be sure the agent through whom you book is a Galapagos specialist with a good knowledge of a wide variety of ships.
translation.yo: Mọ̀ dájú pé aṣojú tí o kọ sínú ìwé pàtàkì Galapagos pẹ̀lú ìmọ̀ kíkún lórí ọ̀kanòjọ̀kan ọkọ̀ ojú omi.

translation.en: This will ensure that your particular interests and/or constraints are matched with the ship most suitable to them.
translation.yo: Eleyii yio ri daju pe awon ohun pato ti o ni ife si ati/tabi idiwo bamu pelu oko oju omi tio dara siwon jul.

translation.en: Before the Spanish arrived in the 16th century, northern Chile was under Inca rule while the indigenous Araucanians (Mapuche) inhabited central and southern Chile.
translation.yo: Ki awon ara Spain to de ni odun 16th century, ariwa orile ede Chile wa ni abe isejoba Inca nigbati awon abinibi Araucanians (Mapuche) n gbe ni aringbungbun ati guusu Chile.

translation.en: The Mapuche were also one of the last independent American indigenous groups, that were not fully absorbed into Spanish-speaking rule until after Chile's independence.
translation.yo: Àwọn Mapuche náà jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára èèyàn Amẹrika tó gba òmìnira kẹ́yìn, tí wọn kò kó sínú ẹ̀yà tó ń sọ èdè Spain títí di ìgbà tí ilẹ́ Chile gba òmìnira.

translation.en: Although Chile declared independence in 1810 (amid the Napoleonic wars that left Spain without a functioning central government for a couple of years), decisive victory over the Spanish was not achieved until 1818.
translation.yo: Ṣùgbọ́n ìlú Chile ní òmínira ní ọdún 1810 (ní àárín ogun napoleon tí ó jẹ́ kí Spain ní ìjọba tí kò ṣiṣẹ́ fún ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọdún}, ìpinnu olúborí Spain kò wá sí ìmúṣẹ títí di 1818.

translation.en: The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a Caribbean country that occupies the eastern half of the island of Hispaniola, which it shares with Haiti
translation.yo: Olominira Dominikan (Ede Speeni: Republica Dominicana ) jẹ́ ilú Karibiani tó pẹ̀lú ìlú Haiti wà ní apá ìlà orùn irekusu Ispaniola.

translation.en: Besides white sand beaches and mountain landscapes, the country is home to the oldest European city in the Americas, now part of Santo Domingo.
translation.yo: Yàtọ̀ sí àwọn yẹ̀pẹ̀ funfun àti àlà ilẹ̀ orí òkè, orílẹ̀èdè ló jẹ́ ilé fáwọn ìlú ilẹ̀ yúròpù ní America, èyí tó ti wà lára Santo Domingo.

translation.en: The island was first inhabited by the Taínos and Caribes. The Caribes were an Arawakan-speaking people who had arrived around 10,000 BCE.
translation.yo: Àwọn ará Taínos àti Caribes ló kọ́kọ́ wà ní erékùsù. Àwọn Caribes ló má ń sọ èdè Arawakani tí wọ́n dé ní ǹkan bi ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́wàá BCE.

translation.en: Within a few short years following the arrival of European explorers, the population of Tainos had significantly been reduced by the Spanish conquerors
translation.yo: Láàrín ọdún díẹ̀ tó tẹ̀lé àwọn aṣàwákiri Europe, iye àwọn ènìyàn ní Tainos ti dínkù nípasẹ̀ àwọn tó ṣẹgun Spain

translation.en: Based on Fray Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias) between 1492 and 1498 the Spanish conquerors killed around 100,000 Taínos.
translation.yo: Níbàámu pẹ̀lú Fray Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias) láàrin ọdún 1492 àti 1498, àwọn aṣẹ́gun ilẹ̀ Spain sekúpa àwọn Taíno tíye wọ́n tó ọgọ́rùn ún ẹgbẹ̀rún.

translation.en: Jardín de la Unión. This space was built as the atrium for a 17th-century convent, of which the Templo de San Diego is the sole surviving building.
translation.yo: Jardin de la Union. A kọ́ ààyè yí gẹ́gẹ́ bíi gbàgede fún ilé ìjọsìn okan ni orundun ketadinlogun, èyí tí tẹ́ḿpìlì de San Diego jẹ́ ilé kan soso tó wà di ìsinsìnyí.

translation.en: It now functions as the central plaza, and always has a lot of things going on, day and night.
translation.yo: Òhun ni wọ́n ń lò gẹ́gẹ́ bí ilé ìtajà gbogbogbo lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́, fún ìdí èyí, oríṣìíríṣìí nǹkan ni ó ń lọ níbẹ̀ tọ̀sán-tòru.

translation.en: There are a number of restaurants surrounding the garden, and in the afternoons and evening there free concerts are often given from the central gazebo.
translation.yo: Àwọn ilé óúnjẹ́ yí ọgbà náà ká, ní ọ̀san àti ní alé wọ́n fún central gazebo ní àwọn orin kíkọ.

translation.en: Callejon del Beso (Alley of the Kiss). Two balconies separated by only 69 centimeters is home of an old love legend.
translation.yo: Callejon del Beso (Titi Ifenukenu). Eyinkule meji ti 69 centimeters nikan lo wa laarin won je ile itan ife atijo.

translation.en: For a few pennies some children will tell you the story.
translation.yo: Fun owo die awon omode kan a so itan naa fun e.

translation.en: Bowen Island is a popular day trip or weekend excursion offering kayaking, hiking, shops, restaurants, and more.
translation.yo: Irukusu Boweni jẹ gbajumo ìrìn àjò ọjọ́ kan tàbí ìparí ọ̀sẹ̀, to pèsè kayaki, irin, ọjà, ilé ounje àti púpọ̀ si.

translation.en: This authentic community is located in Howe Sound just off Vancouver, and is easily accessed via scheduled water taxis departing Granville Island in downtown Vancouver.
translation.yo: Ojúlówó agbègbè yìí la gbé kalẹ̀ ní apá gúúsù ti Howe Sound lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ Vancouver, ó sì rọrùn láti débẹ̀ lórí omi tí ó la erékùsù Granville kọjá ní ìlú Vancouver.

translation.en: For those who enjoy outdoor activities, a trek up the Sea to Sky corridor is essential.
translation.yo: Fún àwọn tí wọn bá fẹ́ràn láti máa gbáfẹ́ ní ìta, rínrìn lọ sí òkun àti àárín òfurufú dár.

translation.en: Whistler (1.5 hour drive from Vancouver) is expensive but well-known because of the 2010 Winter Olympics.
translation.yo: A fọn fèèrè (ìwakọ̀ wákàtí kan ó lé márùn ún láti Vancouver) gbówó lórí à mọ́ ó gbajúmọ̀ látàrí ìdíje ìgbà òtútù Olympic lọ́dún 2010.

translation.en: In the winter, enjoy some of the best skiing in North America, and in the summer try some authentic mountain biking.
translation.yo: Má a gbádùn àwọn eréje ìfò inú yìnyín tó dára jù nígbà òtútù ní ẹkùn àríwá America, àti wíwa alupùpù lórí àpáta to gbámúsé jù lákòókò ooru.

translation.en: Permits must be reserved in advance. You must have a permit to stay overnight at Sirena.
translation.yo: Àwọn ìwé ìgbanilááyè gbodọ ti wà ní ìsẹ̀tò síwáájú. O gbodò ní ìgbanilááyè láti dúró mọ́jú ní Sirena.

translation.en: Sirena is the only ranger station that offers dormitory lodging and hot meals in addition to camping. La Leona, San Pedrillo, and Los Patos offer only camping with no food service.
translation.yo: Sirena ni àgọ rénjì ṣoṣo tó ní àye ilé ìtura àti ounje gbígbóná pẹ̀lú ipago. Ipago láìsí ounje títà nìkan ni àwọn ìpàgọ́ La Liona, San Pedrilo ati Los Patos ma n ṣe.

translation.en: It is possible to secure park permits directly from the Ranger Station in Puerto Jiménez, but they do not accept credit cards
translation.yo: Ó ṣe é ṣe láti rí àṣẹ ibi ìgbọ́kọ̀ sí gbà láti ilé Ranger ni Puerto Jiménez, ṣùgbọ́n wọn kìí gba kààdì ìpọwó

translation.en: The Park Service (MINAE) does not issue park permits more than one month in advance of anticipated arrival.
translation.yo: Ise Ogba Idaraya (MINAE) o ki n fun eeyan ni iwe ase ju osu kan ki eyan to ma de.

translation.en: CafeNet El Sol offers a reservation service for a fee of US$30, or $10 for one-day passes; details on their Corcovado page.
translation.yo: Iléeṣẹ́ CafeNet El Sol ń gba ọgbọ̀n dọ́la US lórí ààyè ìgbásílẹ̀ tàbí dọ́là mẹ́wàá fún ọjọ́ kan; ẹ̀kúnrẹ́rẹ́ wà ní ìtàkùn Corcovado.

translation.en: The Cook Islands are an island country in free association with New Zealand, located in Polynesia, in the middle of the South Pacific Ocean.
translation.yo: Cook Island jẹ island orílẹ́ èdè tó wà ní ẹgbẹ́ ọ̀fẹ́ pẹ̀lú ìlú New Zealand, tó wà ní Polynesia, ní àárín South Pacific Ocean.

translation.en: It is an archipelago with 15 islands spread out over 2.2 million km2 of ocean.
translation.yo: O je asipelago to ni irekusu 15 kaakiri osa fun km2 mimionu 2..

translation.en: With the same time zone as Hawaii, the islands are sometimes thought of as "Hawaii down under".
translation.yo: Pẹ̀lú lílo àkókò kanáà pẹ̀lú Hawaii, àwọn erékùsù ma ń ro Hawaii gẹ́gẹ́ bí “Hawaii tó wà lábẹ́”.

translation.en: Though smaller, it reminds some elderly visitors of Hawaii before statehood without all the large tourist hotels and other development.
translation.yo: Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́pẹ́ o kéré́, o se ìrántí fún àwọn àlẹjò àtijọ́ ilẹ̀ Hawaii kí a tó sọ di ìpínlẹ,̀ láìsí gbogbo àwọn ilẹ́ ìtura nlanla arìnrìn àjò ìgbafẹ́ àti àwọn ìdàgbàsókè míràn.

translation.en: The Cook Islands do not have any cities but are composed of 15 different islands. The main ones are Rarotonga and Aitutaki.
translation.yo: Kò sí ìlú Kankan ní erékùsù Cook ṣùgbọn erékùsù mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dógún ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ ni ó ní. Awọn tí wọ́n ṣe pàtàkì jùlọ ni Rarotonga àti Aitutaki.

translation.en: In developed countries today, providing deluxe bed and breakfasts has been raised to a sort of art-form.
translation.yo: Láwọn orílèèdè tó ni ìdàgbàsóké lónìí, pípèsè ibùsùn tó jíire àti oúnjẹ òwúrọ̀ ti di bí i iṣẹ̀ ọnà.

translation.en: At the top end, B&Bs obviously compete mainly on two main things: bedding and breakfast.
translation.yo: Ní ìparí lókè, B%Bs dára tí a bá ń wo ibùsùn àti óúnjẹ àárọ̀.

translation.en: Accordingly, at the finest such establishments one is apt to find the most luxurious bedding, maybe a handmade quilt or an antique bed.
translation.yo: Bakanna, ni iru ibi ti o dara bayi, eniyan yio ni lero lati ri awon ibusun ti o rewa, boya bi awon ibusun ti a fi owo se loso tabi awon ibusun onise ona.

translation.en: Breakfast may include seasonal delights of the region or the host's speciality dish.
translation.yo: Ó seése kí oùnje òwúrọ̀ kọ pẹ̀lú àwọn ìpèsè aládìídù ẹkùn náà tàbí àsè pàtàkì tí agbàlejò.

translation.en: The setting might be an historic old building with antique furnishings, manicured grounds and a swimming pool.
translation.yo: Ààtò rẹ̀ lè jẹ́ ilé tó ti pẹ́ tónítàn pẹ̀lú àwọn iṣẹ́ ọnà àti ààyè ìlúùwẹ́.

translation.en: Getting into your own car and heading off on a long road trip has an intrinsic appeal in its simplicity.
translation.yo: Wíwọ ọkọ̀ rẹ, pẹ̀lú lílọ sí ọ̀nà jínjìn ní àyò abínibí ní ọ̀nà tó rọrùn .

translation.en: Unlike larger vehicles, you are probably already familiar with driving your car and know its limitations.
translation.yo: Yàtò sí àwọn ọkọ̀ ńlá, o seése kí o tí ní ìmọ̀lára ọkọ̀ rẹ , kí o sì mọ àwọn ìdiwọ̀n rẹ̀ .

translation.en: Setting up a tent on private property or in a town of any size can easily attract unwanted attention.
translation.yo: Síse àgbékalẹ̀ àgọ́ sórí ohun ìní ọlọ́danni tàbí ní ìlú le fa àfojúsí tí a kò fẹ́.

translation.en: In short, using your car is a great way to take a road trip but seldom in itself a way to "camp".
translation.yo: Má fàá gùn lilo mọ́́tò ara eni dara fún irin ajo oju ona ṣùgbọ́́n fún ara re kii se ona lati fi “se ibud.”

translation.en: Car camping is possible if you have a large minivan, SUV, Sedan or Station Wagon with seats that lay down.
translation.yo: Ibudo inuoko seese ti o ba ni oko nla mnifaani, SUV abi Station Wagon to ni ijoko ti o le sun sile.

translation.en: Some hotels have a heritage from the golden age of steam railways and ocean liners; before the Second World War, in the 19th or early 20th centuries.
translation.yo: Àwọn ilé ìtura kan ma n ní ohun ìní láti àkókò iyebíye ti relúwé elérúkú àtì ọkọ̀ inú omi; ki Ogun Àgbáyé Kejì tó jà ní senturi 19th tàbí ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ senturi 20th.

translation.en: These hotels were where the rich and the famous of the day would stay, and often had fine dining and nightlife.
translation.yo: Ilé ìtura yìí ní àwọn tó lówó tí wọ́n sì ní ọ́rọ̀ ma dúró si, wọ́n sì ní àyè ibi óúnjẹ́.

translation.en: The old fashioned fittings, the lack of the latest amenities, and a certain graceful agedness are also part of their character.
translation.yo: Lára àwọn ìsesí wọn ni ẹ̀ṣọ́ aṣọ tó dúró ‘re ọlọ́jọ́ pípẹ́, àìní àwọn ohun amáyérọrùn tìgbàlódé àtàwọn ohun àkúwórí míràn.

translation.en: While they are usually privately owned, they sometimes accommodate visiting heads of state and other dignitaries.
translation.yo: Biotilejepe àdání ni wọ́n jẹ́, wọ́n ma n sábà gba àwọn olórí ìlú àti àwọn èyàn pàtàkì òmíràn wọlé.

translation.en: A traveller with piles of money might consider a round the world flight, broken up with stays in many of these hotels.
translation.yo: Arìnrìnàjò tó lówó púpọ̀ lè rísí ìrìn àjò káà kiri ay.

translation.en: A hospitality exchange network is the organization that connects travelers with locals in the cities they are going to visit.
translation.yo: Ìgbàlejò tó ṣe pàṣípàra nẹ́tíwọkì jẹ ilé iṣẹ́ tí o so àwọn arinrìn àjò pọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn ìbílẹ̀ nínu àwọn ìlú tí wọ́n fẹ́ ṣe àbẹ̀wò sí.

translation.en: Joining such a network usually just requires filling out an online form; although some networks offer or require additional verification.
translation.yo: Láti darapọ̀ mọ́ irú àkójọ bí èyí, o kàn nílò láti buwọlu fọ́ọ̀mù lórí ìtàkùn ayélujára; lóòótọ́, irú àkójọ yìí nílò àyẹ̀wò míràn.

translation.en: A listing of available hosts is then provided either in print and/or online, sometimes with references and reviews by other travelers.
translation.yo: Won a wa fun ni ni akosile gbogbo awon agbalejo to wa nile o le je loju iwe tabi loju intaneeti, nigbamiin won ma n fi ero awon onirinajo miin.

translation.en: Couchsurfing was founded in January 2004 after computer programmer Casey Fenton found a cheap flight to Iceland but did not have a place to stay.
translation.yo: Won bere couchsurfing ni Sere 2004 leyin ti onimo komputa Kasi Fentoni ri tikeeti lati fo lo si Iselandi lofe sugbon ko ri bi duro s.

translation.en: He emailed students at the local university and received an overwhelming number of offers for free accommodation.
translation.yo: Ó kọ̀wé ránṣẹ́ sí àwọn àkẹ́ẹ̀kọ́ ní ilé ẹ̀kọ́ gíga fásitì abẹ́lé, ó sì rí àgbàyanu ìfilọ̀ fún iléègbé ọ̀fẹ́ gbà.

translation.en: Hostels cater primarily to young people – a typical guest is in their twenties – but you can often find older travellers there too.
translation.yo: Àwọn ilé ìtura ma ń tọ́jú àwọn ọ̀dọ́mọdé- àwọn àlejò wọn ló ma ń wà lọ́mọ ogún ọdún- àmọ́ o lè rí àwọn àgbàlagbà arìnrìnàjò náà níbẹ̀ pẹ̀lu.

translation.en: Families with children are a rare sight, but some hostels do allow them in private rooms.
translation.yo: Ósọ̀wọ́n láti rí àwọn ìdílé pẹ̀lú ọmọ, ṣùgbọ́n àwọn iléègbé àwọn akẹ́ẹ̀kọ́ máa ń fàyè gbà wọn ní yàrá àdáni.

translation.en: The city of Beijing in China will be the host city of the Olympic Winter Games in 2022, which will make it the first city to have hosted both the summer and winter Olympics.
translation.yo: Ìlú Beijing ní orílẹ̀èdè China ni yío gba àlejò ìdíje Olympic nígbà òtútù lọ́dún 2022, èyí tí yíò jẹ́ ìlú àkọ́kọ́ tí yíò gbàlejò olympic ti àkókò ooru àti òtútù.

translation.en: Beijing will host the opening and closing ceremonies and the indoor ice events.
translation.yo: Beijing yíò gbà àlejò ayẹyẹ ìbẹ̀rẹ àti ìkásẹ̀nílẹ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn eré ìdárayá yìnyín nínú ilé.

translation.en: Other skiing events will be at the Taizicheng ski area in Zhangjiakou, about 220 km (140 miles) from Beijing.
translation.yo: Àwọn ètò fífò míràn ni yíò wáyé ní ibi ìfò Zhangjiakou, ní ǹkan bi kìlómítà okòólénígba (ogóje máilì) látọ̀dọ Beijing..

translation.en: Most of the temples do have an Annual festival starting from November end to Mid of May, which varies according to each temple's annual calendar.
translation.yo: Púpọ̀ nínú àwọn tempili lo ma n ṣe ayẹyẹ ọdún lati ìparí Belú dé àrín Èbìbí tí ó ma n yàtọ̀ síra torí kalenda tempili kookan.

translation.en: Most of the temple festivals is celebrated as part of temple's anniversary or presiding deity's birthday or any other major event associated with the temple.
translation.yo: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ àwọn ayẹyẹ tẹ̀ḿpìlì ni wọ́n ń se gẹ́gẹ́ bí i àjọ̀dú tẹ́m̀pìlì tàbí ayẹyẹ ọjọ́ ìbí aládarí òriṣà tàbí àwọn ayẹyẹ gbòógì míràn tí wọ́n lọ́ mọ́ tẹ́ḿpìlì.

translation.en: Kerala's temple festivals are very interesting to see, with regular procession of decorated elephants, temple orchestra and other festivities.
translation.yo: Àjọ̀dún Ilé ìjọsin Kerala ó dùnwò pẹ̀lú ìwòde àwọn erin tí a ṣe lọ́ṣọ̀ọ́, àwọn olórin ilé ìjọsìn àti àwọn ayęyę òmíràn.

translation.en: A World's Fair (commonly called World Exposition, or simply Expo) is large international festival of arts and sciences.
translation.yo: Ijade Aye Kan (ti a maa n pe ni Isipaya Aye tabi “Espo” lasan) is ni ayeye nla gbogbogbo nipa ara ati sayensi.

translation.en: Participating countries present artistic and educational displays in national pavilions to showcase world issues or their country's culture and history.
translation.yo: Awon ilu to ko pa fi idan alara ati arikogbon han ni awon iyewu ile lati toka si awon oro agbaye tabi asa ati itan ilu won.

translation.en: International Horticultural Expositions are specialised events which showcase floral displays, botanical gardens and anything else to do with plants.
translation.yo: Ètò ìjíròrò àgbáyé tàwọn tó ní nǹkan se pẹ̀lú ọ̀gbìn òdòdó jẹ́ èyí tó má ń se àfihàn àwọn orísìírísìí nǹkan mìíràn tó níí se pẹ̀lú ohun ọ̀gbìn.

translation.en: Although in theory they can take place annually (so long as they are in different countries), in practice they are not.
translation.yo: Bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé nínú tíọ́rí, wọ́n lè wáyé lọ́dọọdún (tí ó bá ṣá à ti jẹ́ orílẹ̀ èdè ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀), in ojúkoju wọn kò rí bẹ́ẹ.

translation.en: These events normally last anywhere between three and six months, and are held on sites no smaller than 50 hectares.
translation.yo: Ètò yìí kò yẹ kí ó kọjá oṣù mẹta sí mẹ́sàn án ní ibikíbi, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni àwọn ibi tí wọ́n lò kò gbọdọ̀ kéré ju 50 hectares lọ.

translation.en: There are many different film formats that have been used over the years. Standard 35 mm film (36 by 24 mm negative) is much the commonest.
translation.yo: Àwọn ọ̀nà oríṣiríṣi fiìmù ló wà tí a ti lò ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọdún sẹ́yìn. Gbẹ̀déke fíìmù jé 35 mm (36 by 24 negative) ló wọ́pọ̀ jù.

translation.en: It can usually be replenished fairly easily if you run out, and gives resolution roughly comparable to a current DSLR.
translation.yo: O rọrùn láti dápadà lọ́pọ ìgbà nígbàti´ o ba lọ tan, o si tún fi ìmọ́lè to fé figagbága pèlú lensi oníyíyí olójú kan òdẹ òní.

translation.en: Some medium-format film cameras use a 6 by 6 cm format, more precisely a 56 by 56 mm negative.
translation.yo: Díẹ̀ nínú àwọn kámẹ́rà fíìmù alábọ́dé ló ń lo ìlànà mẹ́fà sí mẹ́fà sẹ̀ńtímítà, ní pàtó ó ní mẹ́rìndínlọ́gọ́ta sí mẹ́rìndínlọ́gọ́ta mm òdì.

translation.en: This gives resolution almost four times that of a 35 mm negative (3136 mm2 versus 864).
translation.yo: Èyí mú ìdánilójú wá tó ẹ̀ẹ̀mẹẹ̀rin mìlímítà márùndínlógójì (3136 mm2 versus 864).

translation.en: Wildlife is among the most challenging motifs for a photographer, and needs a combination of good luck, patience, experience and good equipment.
translation.yo: Ẹranko ìgbẹ́ ni o nira jùlo fún ayàwòrán láti yà, o nílò àpapọ̀ ìdúró ire, sùúrù, ìrírí àti irinṣẹ́ tí ó yanrantí.

translation.en: Wildlife photography is often taken for granted, but like photography in general, a picture is worth a thousand words.
translation.yo: A ma ń fi ọwọ́ yẹpẹrẹ mún àwòrán àwọn ẹranko abẹ̀mí sùgbọ́n bí i àwòrán lápapọ̀, àwòrán kan tó ẹgbẹ̀rún ọ̀rọ̀.

translation.en: Wildlife photography often requires a long telephoto lens, though things like a flock of birds or a tiny creature need other lenses.
translation.yo: Aworan yiya ẹranko igbo ma n nilo lẹnsi tẹlifoto gigun, amọ awọn nkan bii ẹgbẹ ẹyẹ to n fo abi ohun alaye kekere ma n nilo awọn lẹnsi miin.

translation.en: Many exotic animals are hard to find, and parks sometimes have rules about taking photographs for commercial purposes.
translation.yo: Púpọ̀ nínu àwọn ẹranko tó dàra ṣòro láti rí, bẹ́ẹ̀ àwọn ibi ìgbafẹ́ ma ń ní òfin nípa yíya àwòrán fún ìpolówó ọjà.

translation.en: Wild animals might either be shy or aggressive. The environment might be cold, hot, or otherwise hostile.
translation.yo: Àwọn eranko búburú lè jẹ́ onítìjú tàbí kí wọ́n burú. Agbègbè náà lè tutù, gbaná tàbí kò le.

translation.en: The world has over 5,000 different languages, including more than twenty with 50 million or more speakers.
translation.yo: Àwọn onírúurú ẹ̀dẹ̀ to kọjá ẹgbèrún márùn lówà làgbáyé, pèlú díè lẹ ní ogun tí àádọ́ta milionu eyan gbo.

translation.en: Written words are often easier to understand than spoken words, also. This is especially true of addresses, which are often difficult to pronounce intelligibly.
translation.yo: Ọ̀rọ̀ tí a kọ sílẹ̀ a máa yánilára láti rántí ju èyí tí a gbọ́ lọ, pẹ̀lú. Nínú ìwe ajúwe ọnà ni ènìyàn ti le è mọ iyì èyí jùlọ, pàapàá àwọn ibi tí o ṣòro láti pè lẹ́nu.

translation.en: Many entire nations are completely fluent in English, and in even more you can expect a limited knowledge - especially among younger people.
translation.yo: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ́ gbogbo orírílẹ̀ èdè ló lè sọ èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì dáadáa, àti pé o lè rí òye níbẹ̀ pàápàá ní àárín àwọn ọ̀dọ́.

translation.en: Imagine, if you will, a Mancunian, Bostonian, Jamaican and Sydneysider sitting around a table having dinner at a restaurant in Toronto.
translation.yo: Ìwọ kàn rò ó, tí ìwọ tí o jẹ́ Mancunian, Bostonian, Jamaican àti Sydneysider jókòó sí orí tábílì láti jẹun alẹ́ ni ilé ońjẹ ni Toront.

translation.en: They're regaling each other with stories from their hometowns, told in their distinct accents and local argot.
translation.yo: Wọ́n ń dára wọn lára yá pẹ̀lú àwọn ìtàn láti ìlú wọn; oníkàlùkù sọ àwọn ìtàn náà pẹ̀lú ìsọ̀rọ̀sì èdè àdúgbò wọn.

translation.en: Buying food in supermarkets is usually the cheapest way to get fed. Without cooking opportunities, choices are however limited to ready-made food.
translation.yo: Ríra oúnjẹ ní ilé ìtajà ma ń dínwó jù láti lè yó. Láláì ní àǹfání ìdáná, kò sí ààyò oúnjẹ tó ti délẹ̀ lọ́pọ̀.

translation.en: Increasingly supermarkets are getting a more varied section of ready-made food. Some even provide a microwave oven or other means to heat food.
translation.yo: Àwọn ọjà ǹkan orsiríṣi ní abala ti àwọn óúnjẹ tí wọ́n ti sè sílẹ̀ púpọ̀ si. Àwọn kan ti ẹ̀ pèsè ẹ̀rọ tó má mú óúnjẹ gbọ́ná tàbí ọ̀nà míràn tí o lè mú óúnjẹ gbóná.

translation.en: In some countries or types of stores there is at least one on-site restaurant, often a rather informal one with affordable prices.
translation.yo: Láwọn oríléèdè kan, ó kéré tán ilé oúnjẹ orí ìtàkùn ayélujára yóó wà ju àwọn tìbílẹ̀ tó jẹ́ olówó tí kò gunpá lọ.

translation.en: Make and carry copies of your policy and your insurer's contact details with you.
translation.yo: Sètò kí o sí mú àwọn èdà ìwẹ́ ètò ìmúlò àti àwọn àlàyé ìkànsíra-eni tí adójútòfò rẹ pèlú re.

translation.en: They need to show the insurer's e-mail address and international phone numbers for advice/authorizations and making claims.
translation.yo: Wọ́n nílò láti sàfihàn í-miìlì olùgbésíta àti ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ ilẹ̀ òkèrè fún ìyànjú/àṣẹ àti ìsàfimúnlẹ̀.

translation.en: Have another copy in your luggage and online (e-mail to yourself with attachment, or stored in the "cloud").
translation.yo: Ni ẹ̀dà míràn nínú ẹrù àti orí ìtàkùn ( fi ímeèlì pẹ̀lú àfikún ṣọwọ́ sí ara rẹ̀ tàbí sínú “afẹ́fẹ́”).

translation.en: If traveling with a laptop or tablet, store a copy in its memory or disc (accessible without the internet).
translation.yo: Ti o ba n rin irinjo pelu komputa alagbeka, fi idakeji kan si agbari e abi si inu diski (ti o le ri lo lai si ayelujara).

translation.en: Also give policy/contact copies to traveling companions and relatives or friends back home willing to help.
translation.yo: Pèlú fi àwọn ẹ̀dà èto ìmúlò/ìkànsín fún àwọn ẹlẹ́gbẹ́ arìnrìn àjò àti àwọn ẹbí tàbí ọ̀rẹ́ ní ilé tó fẹ́ láti sẹ ìrànwọ́.

translation.en: Moose (also known as elk) aren't inherently aggressive, but will defend themselves if they perceive a threat.
translation.yo: Moose (tí a ms sí elk) kò kín bínu, ṣùgbọ́n wọ́n ma gbèjà ara wọn tí wọ́n bá kófìrí ìjà.

translation.en: When people don't see moose as potentially dangerous, they may approach too closely and put themselves at risk.
translation.yo: Nígbàtí àwọn ènìyàn kò bá rí èkúté bí ohun tó léwu, wọ́n lè sún mọ́ ọn jù léyìí tó sì le fa ewu fún wọn.

translation.en: Drink alcoholic drinks with moderation. Alcohol affects everyone differently, and knowing your limit is very important.
translation.yo: Máa fi ìwọ̀nsí mu ọtí. Ipá tí ọti ma n kó lára èyàn ma n yàtọ̀ síra ó ṣe pàtàkì láti mo àfara rẹ.

translation.en: Possible long term health events from excessive drinking can include liver damage and even blindness and death. The potential danger is increased when consuming illegally produced alcohol.
translation.yo: Lára àwọn àìlera tí ọtí àmujù fún ìgbà pípẹ́ máa ń fà sí àgọ́ ara ní àìsàn ẹ̀dọ̀, ìfọ́jú, àti ikú pẹ̀lú. Ewu yìí máa ń pọ̀ gidi nígbàtí ẹnì kan bá lo àwọn oríṣìíríṣìí nǹkan ti ó ní ọtí ninú ṣùgbọ́n tí kò tọ̀nà lábẹ́ òfi.

translation.en: Illegal spirits can contain various dangerous impurities including methanol, which can cause blindness or death even in small doses.
translation.yo: Àwọn ẹ̀mí tó lòdì sí fin le ni awon idooti ti o ma n fa ijamba pupo ninu, die ninu won ni methanol, èyí tí ò le fa ojú fífọ́ díẹ díẹ̀.

translation.en: Eyeglasses can be cheaper in a foreign country, especially in low-income countries where labour costs are lower.
translation.yo: Dígí ojú lè má gbé owó lórí púpọ̀ ni ilẹ̀ òkèrè, pàápàá ni àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè tí èto ọrọ̀ ajé wọn kò dára t.

translation.en: Consider getting an eye exam at home, especially if insurance covers it, and bringing the prescription along to be filed elsewhere.
translation.yo: Fọkàn sí I láti ṣe ìdánwò ojú ní ilé, pàápàá tí adójútòfò rẹ bá gbé e, kí o mú èsì rẹ wá kí a lè fi pamọ́ fún .

translation.en: High-end brand-name frames available in such areas may have two problems; some may be knock-offs, and the real imported ones may be more expensive than at home.
translation.yo: Awọn ọjà àti nǹkan tí o ní orúkọ tí o máa ń wà ní agbègbè náà máa ní ìṣòro méjì; àwọn kan lè ti bàjẹ́, kí àwọn tí wọn sì jẹ́ ojúlówó tí ilẹ̀ òkèrè gbówólórí ju ti ilé lọ.

translation.en: Coffee is one of the world's most traded commodities, and you can probably find many types in your home region.
translation.yo: Kọfí jẹ́ ọ̀kan nínú àwọn ohun èlò tí wọ́n ń tà lágbàáyé, o sì lè rí i ní ọ̀pọ̀ ẹkùn ilé rẹ.

translation.en: Nevertheless, there are many distinctive ways of drinking coffee around the world that are worth experiencing.
translation.yo: Àmọ́sá, ọ̀pọ̀ ọ̀nà ọ̀dọ̀ lówà láti fi mún kọfí káàkiri àgbáyé tí o ní láti nírìírí.

translation.en: Canyoning (or: canyoneering) is about going in a bottom of a canyon, which is either dry or full of water.
translation.yo: Kanyonini (abi: kanyonierini) ni lilo si abe canyoni, to le gbe abi ki o kun fun omi.

translation.en: Canyoning combines elements from swimming, climbing and jumping--but requires relatively little training or physical shape to get started (compared to rock climbing, scuba diving or alpine skiing, for example).
translation.yo: Canyoning se àkójọ àwọn èròjà láti lúwẹ̀ẹ́ nínú omi, gígùn kè, fífò--àmọ́ ó bèèrè fún ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ráńpẹ́ tàbí àpẹrẹ igun ara láti bẹ̀rẹ̀ (fífi wé àpáta gígùn, wíwa scuba, tàbí fífò alphine fún àpẹrẹ).

translation.en: Hiking is an outdoor activity which consists of walking in natural environments, often on hiking trails.
translation.yo: Hiking jẹ́ eré ìta gbangba, tí ènìyàn máa ń ṣe, nípa rínrìn lórí ìlà rẹ̀.

translation.en: Day hiking involves distances of less than a mile up to longer distances that can be covered in a single day.
translation.yo: Ìrìn lójúmọmọ nííṣe pẹ̀lú rínrin ìrìn tí kò jìnnà ju máìlì kan lọ sí ààyè tí ó lè rìn lọ́jọ́ kan ṣoṣo.

translation.en: For a day hike along an easy trail little preparations are needed, and any moderately fit person can enjoy them.
translation.yo: Fún rínrín ìrìnàjò lọ́nà ìtọpa tó rọrùn ìmúra díẹ̀ lo níló, àti wípé ẹnikẹ́ni tó dápé ní ìwọ̀ntuwọ̀nsì lẹ jẹ́ ìgbádùn wọn.

translation.en: Families with small children may need more preparations, but a day outdoors is easily possible even with babies and pre-school children.
translation.yo: Awon ebi to ni omo kekere le nilo igbaradi si, sugbon o seese ki eyan lo ojo kan ni ita gbangba pelu awon omo ikoko ati omo jelesimi gaan.

translation.en: Internationally, there are nearly 200 running tour organizations. Most of them operate independently.
translation.yo: Nílẹ̀ òkère, lé ìṣe tó ń rí sí rínrín ìrìnàjò afẹ tó igba. Ọ̀pọ̀ nínú wọn ló sì dá dúró .

translation.en: The Global Running Tours successor, Go Running Tours networks dozens of sightrunning providers on four continents.
translation.yo: Agbapo ere sisa ni irinajo agbaye, Go Running Tours, se netiwooki fun opo awon olupese wiwo era sisa ni continent merin.

translation.en: With roots in Barcelona's Running Tours Barcelona and Copenhagen's Running Copenhagen, it was quickly joined by Running Tours Prague based in Prague and others.
translation.yo: Pẹ̀lú orísun rẹ̀ nínú ìsárékiri afẹ́ ti ilẹ̀ Barcelona ìyẹn Running Tours Barcelona àti Copenhagen's Running Copenhagen, ó tètè darapọ̀ pẹ̀lú Running Tours Prague tó fi ilú Prague se ibi ìjóòkó àtàwọn mìíràn.

translation.en: There are many things you have to take into consideration before and when you travel somewhere.
translation.yo: Ó ní àwọn nǹkan kọ̀ọ̀kan tí o gbọdọ̀ máa rò tí o bá rin ìrìn àjo lọ ibì ka.

translation.en: When you travel, expect things not to be like they are "back home". Manners, laws, food, traffic, lodging, standards, language and so on will to some extent differ from where you live.
translation.yo: Nigbakugba to ba rin irinajo, mo daju pe gbogbo nkan kole dabi bo se ri “nile”, ise,ofin, ounje, ilegbe, osuwon, ede, ati bebe lo yo yato si ibi ti o ti n bo.

translation.en: This is something you always need to keep in mind, to avoid disappointment or perhaps even distaste over local ways to do things.
translation.yo: Ohùn kan wà tí o ní láti má a fi sọ́kàn nígbàgbogbo, láti yàgò fún ìjákulẹ̀ tàbí yẹra fún àwọn ọ̀nà àìda tìbílẹ̀ ti wọ́n fi ń se nǹkan.

translation.en: Travel agencies have been around since the 19th century. A travel agent is usually a good option for a journey which extends beyond a traveller's previous experience of nature, culture, language or low-income countries.
translation.yo: Àwọn iléeṣẹ́ ìrìnàjò ti wà láti sẹ́ńtùrì kọkàndínlógún. Osìṣẹ́ iléẹṣẹ́ ló yẹ fún ìrìnàjò èyí tó náwọ́jà dọ́dọ̀ àwọn arìnàjò tó ní ìrírí àyíká, àṣà, èdè, tàbí orílẹ̀ tí kò pawó lọ́pọ̀.

translation.en: Although most agencies are willing to take on most regular bookings, many agents specialise in particular types of travel, budget ranges or destinations.
translation.yo: Lóòótọ́, ọ̀pọ̀ iléeṣẹ́ ló ma ń fẹ́ láti se àkọọ́lẹ̀ déédé, ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn aṣojú ló má ń gbájúmọ́ ẹka ìrìnàjò kan, ìṣúná àti ibi tí wọ́n ń lọ.

translation.en: It can be better to use an agent who frequently books similar trips to yours.
translation.yo: Ó má ń dára láti lo asojú tó má ń gba ààyè ìrìn àjò tó fara pẹ́ tìrẹ.

translation.en: Take a look at what trips the agent is promoting, whether on a website or in a shop window.
translation.yo: Ṣe àgbéyẹ̀wò àwọn ìrìnàjò tí awọn olùpolówó ọjà ń se àgbélárugẹ, yálà ní orí ìtàkùn àgbáyé ni tàbí ní ojú fèrèsè ilé ìtajà.

translation.en: If you want to see the world on the cheap, for necessity, lifestyle or challenge, there are some ways to do that.
translation.yo: To o ba fe sipaya aye fun owo kekere, fun ini pataki, igbesiaye abi fun iyaju, ona wa ti o le fi se be.

translation.en: Basically, they fall into two categories: Either work while you travel or try and limit your expenses. This article is focused on the latter.
translation.yo: Looto won pin si ipele meji: boya wa sise nigba ti o ba n rin irin ajo tabi ko gbiyanju lati din owo nina re ku. Aroko eyi tokasi ti igbeyin.

translation.en: For those willing to sacrifice comfort, time and predictability to push expenses down close to zero, see minimum budget travel.
translation.yo: Fún àwọn tó fẹ́ pàdánù ìtura wọn, àkókò àti àsọtẹlẹ̀ láti ti ìnáwó sílẹ̀, wo àpọ̀jù ìṣúná owó ìrìn àjò.

translation.en: The advice assumes that travellers do not steal, trespass, participate in the illegal market, beg, or otherwise exploit other people for their own gain.
translation.yo: Ìmọ̀ràn náà gbèrò wípé àwọn arìnrìn-àjò kò ní jalè, kọjá àyè, kópa nínú ọjà lòdì sí òfin, tọrọ, tàbí lọ́ àwọn ènìyàn mìírànlọ́wọ́ gbà fún tí ara ẹni.

translation.en: An immigration checkpoint is usually the first stop when disembarking from a plane, a ship, or another vehicle.
translation.yo: Ẹnubodè aṣíkiri nìdúró àkọ́kọ́ bí wọ́n bá ń bọ́ sílẹ̀ látinú bàálù, ọkọ̀ ojú omi tàbí inú ọkọ̀ míràn.

translation.en: In some cross-border trains inspections are done on the running train and you should have valid ID with you when boarding one of those trains.
translation.yo: Ní ibi rírékọjá ààlà ayẹ̀wò àwọn ọkọ̀ ojú-irin màa n wáyé àti wípé́ o ní láti ní káàdì ìdánímò tó dántó pẹ́lù rẹ nígbàtí o bá ń wọ àwọn ọkọ̀ ojú-irin wọ̀nyí.

translation.en: On night sleeper trains, passports may be collected by the conductor so that you do not have your sleep interrupted.
translation.yo: àwọn agbèrò lè gba ìwé ìrìnnà lọ́wọ́ rẹ àwọn nínú ọkọ̀ ojú irin olóorun alẹ̀, kí wọ́n má ba à dá oorun mọ́ ọ lójú.

translation.en: Registration is an additional requirement for the visa process. In some countries, you must register your presence and address where you are staying with the local authorities.
translation.yo: Ìforúkọsílẹ̀ jẹ́ àfikún tí a nílò fún ìṣètò visa. Ní àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè kànkan, o ní láti forúkọsílẹ̀ fún wíwá rẹ àti àdírẹ́sì ibi tí ò ń gbé fún àwọn tó wà ní ipò àṣẹ sílẹ̀.

translation.en: This might require filling out a form with the local police or a visit to the immigration offices.
translation.yo: Ó se é se kí èyí béèrè sísàkọọ́lẹ̀ fọ́ọ̀mù pẹ̀lú olopa agbegbe tabi sàbẹ̀wò sí ọ́fìsì àwọn aṣíkiri.

translation.en: In many countries with such a law, local hotels will handle the registration (make sure to ask).
translation.yo: Ni ọpọ orilẹede to ni iru ofin naa, awọn ile itura kekeke ni wọn ma moju to iforukọsilẹ( ri daju pe o bere).

translation.en: In other cases, only those staying outside of tourist accommodations need to register.  However, this makes the law much more obscure, so find out beforehand.
translation.yo: Ní ìgbà mìíràn, àwọn tó ń gbé ní ìta ilé ìgbé àwọn-onírìnkiri afẹ́ nílò láti fi orúkọ sílẹ̀. Síbẹ̀, èyí kò jẹ́́ kí òfin náà wà ní gbangba, torí náà kí o wádìí saájú.

translation.en: Architecture is concerned with the design and construction of buildings. The architecture of a place is often a tourist attraction in its own right.
translation.yo: Iṣẹ́ Ilé Yíyà jęmọ́ yíyà àti kíkọ́ ilé. Iṣẹ́ Ile yíyà ibi kan lásán lè jẹ́ ohun tó ń fa àwọn oní ìrìn àjò afẹ́ sí ibi náà.

translation.en: Many buildings are quite beautiful to look at and the view from a tall building or from a cleverly-positioned window can be a beauty to behold.
translation.yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ilẹ́ màa ń dára láti wò àti wípẹ́ ìwòye láti orí ilé gogoro tàbí làti ojú fèrèsè ta fi ọgbọ́n gbẹ̀kalè màa ǹ dára láti wò.

translation.en: Architecture overlaps considerably with other fields including urban planning, civil engineering, decorative arts, interior design and landscape design.
translation.yo: Ìyàwòrán ilé ti kọjá pẹ̀lú àwọn ikọ̀ tókù pẹ̀lú ètò agbègbè tó lajú, ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ àwọn tó ń kọ́alé, iṣl ọnà alárà, aṣe inú ilé lẹ́ṣọ̀ọ́ àti ìyàwòrán oníbùú.

translation.en: Given how remote many of the pueblos are, you won't be able to find a significant amount of nightlife without traveling to Albuquerque or Santa Fe.
translation.yo: Pelu bii awon pueblos se juna si ilu, o ni le ri agbo igbadun ale Kankan to po lai de Albakoki.

translation.en: However, nearly all of the casinos listed above serve drinks, and several of them bring in name-brand entertainment (primarily the large ones immediately surrounding Albuquerque and Santa Fe).
translation.yo: Síbèsíbè, o féè to gbogbo ilé tẹ́tẹ́ ti a kà sílè lókè, lo n ta ọtí, púpọ̀ nínú wọn wọn si ma n mú ìdárayá olórúkọ na (pàápàá jùlọ àwọn ti o tibi gidi ti o wa ní agbẹ̀gbẹ̀ Albuquerque àti Santa Fei.

translation.en: Beware: small-town bars here are not always good places for the out-of-state visitor to hang out.
translation.yo: Ṣọ́ra: àwọn ilé otí ìlú kéèké níbí kìí ṣe ibi tí ó fi taratara dára fún àwọn alejò láti jade lọ gbáfẹ́.

translation.en: For one thing, northern New Mexico has significant problems with drunk driving, and the concentration of intoxicated drivers is high close to small-town bars.
translation.yo: Fun nkan eyokan, apa ariwa ilu Mexico ni isoro pelu oko wiwa ati oti mimu, ati bi apejopo awon awako ti o ti mu oti yo se ga ni awon ile oti kekeke.

translation.en: Unwanted murals or scribble is known as graffiti.
translation.yo: Àwọn ẹ̀yà àti àrà àkànṣe tí a ò bèrè là n pè ní grafit.

translation.en: While it's far from a modern phenomenon, most people probably associate it with youth vandalizing public and private property using spray paint.
translation.yo: Biotilejepe ó yàtọ̀ sí àwọn ǹkan òde òní, ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn èèyàn ma ń lọ mọ́ báwọn ọ̀dọ́ se ń ba ohun ìní ìjọba àti aládaní jẹ́ nípa lílo ọ̀dà fínfín.

translation.en: However, nowadays there are established graffiti artists, graffiti events and "legal" walls. Graffiti paintings in this context often resemble artworks rather than illegible tags.
translation.yo: Àmọ́ṣá, láwọn àkókò yìí, àwọn eléré ayàwòrán ara ògiri tí kò tọ̀nọ̀ àtàwọn èyí tó tọ̀nà. ìyàwòrán Graffiti nínú àkọọ́lẹ̀ yìí sàfihàn àwọn àwòrán tó jọra wan jú àwọn èyí tí ó jẹ́ táàgì aláìbófinmun.

translation.en: Boomerang throwing is a popular skill that many tourists want to acquire.
translation.yo: Jíju bumuráǹgì jẹ́ ìmọ̀ọ́se tó wọ́pọ̀ tí ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn arìnrìnàjò ma ń fẹ́ láti mọ̀ọ́ se.

translation.en: If you want to learn throwing a boomerang that comes back to your hand, make sure you have a suitable boomerang for returning.
translation.yo: Bí o bá fẹ́ kọ́ nípa jíju boomerang tó padà sí ọ lọ́wọ́, se àrídájú pé o n.

translation.en: Most boomerangs available in Australia are in fact non-returning. It is best for beginners to not try throwing in windy
translation.yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ọnà onígi tó wà ní Australia kò se é dá padà. Ó dára kí àwọn tó sẹ̀ ń bẹ̀rẹ má jù ú sínú afẹ́fẹ́.̀

translation.en: A Hangi Meal is cooked in a hot pit in the ground.
translation.yo: Ounje Hangi ma n je sise ninu iho gbigbe gbigbona.

translation.en: The pit is either heated with hot stones from a fire, or in some places geothermal heat makes areas of ground naturally hot.
